title: I on November 22nd 2019 purchased‚Ä¶
text: I on November 22nd 2019 purchased iphone 11 pro max mobile, I found auto restart issue. Later I went to icare service center so they restored the device and gave back saying everything fixed and the very next day same thing continued again I visited service center, they kept my mobile for observation about 24 hrs they denied my complaint by saying no problem with device, gave me report stating all tests passed and told me to take a video if it gets restarts so that there will be proof (sounds very funny because I wont be holding my mob whenever it gets restarts) they also told me to contact iphone customer care they might help.... I followed, I explained the issue with customer care people they took nearly a week and said there is an "hardware issue found in your device as per their internal team report" so goto service center, I took an appointment by 3PM customer care girl told me that she will give me call same and tell service center people about the issue, at exactly 3PM she called me and disconnected immediately I don't know why, I was waiting at service center by that time hoping that she will call again but I got an email saying "we tried calling you were unable to respond so we will call you in 24hrs" I was surprised by the service by both service center and customer care, I was waiting in service center so i again called customer care and new person again I explained everything happened by this it was already4pm, she told that she will explain about the hardware issue to service center girl. Once I gave call to service center girl I don't know she disconnected what the hell was going on!!!!! again I contacted new customer care person same repeats..... service center guys just wanted a email confirmation about the hardware issue as they did not find it.. but they denied saying they can't send email but orally they can say, but these fellows told customer care people are giving fake promises we can't help at the end time was almost 6pm!!!!! I gave device there and they kept for observation I didn't understand what's the point of keeping my device for observation as they already got to know that there is an hardware issue?? I gave and showed the so called proof video of device getting restart and few pics reports... after 4 days they called me and told there is no problem with device I don't understand how these people making me fool and roam around these days it's so evident that there is problem with device but one will say there is hardware issue another says no your device is perfect I'm facing this issue I invested my money on defected piece and for that this is the response I get great I had lot of expectations but these people!!!!!! It's new phone and these issues and response freaking!!! Instead of replacing my phone they are making me fool!!!

title: Missing AirPods
text: I ordered AirPods for myself as a treat, they were then shipped with no tracking but I was satisfied that they wouldn‚Äôt have been delivered without a signature as they‚Äôre ¬£200. title: Very disappointed in Apples security
text: Very disappointed in Apples security! My AirPods were taken off my desk at work and all the person had to do was hold the button down on the back of the case for 20 seconds and the pods sync to their phone! I dont even get a notification that such a thing has happened. By the time I realized they were, they were synced to their new owner. I would have been much happier to be able to call Apple Support, provide the device serial number, and had the agent disable them. At least then the thief cant benefit from their actions. Its pretty upsetting to spend so much money on something that takes someone 20 to sync to their phone and Im just outta luck. Im beyond disappointed with Apples security. I would like to see Apple step it up and at least send a notification that the pods were synced to a new device.

title: DO NOT BY APPLE COMPUTERS
text: DO NOT BY APPLE COMPUTERS!  We bought two extremely expensive computers from Apple 4 years ago.  Each has broken 4 times, mine has finally died totally.  They get very basic use and not a lot of it.  We bought hoping they would last and be good quality.  How wrong could we have been?  Each time they break we have to drive over an hour to take to the repair shop.  Often we have to leave it and go back again to collect another day.  Our son bought a non-apple desk top computer 6 years ago.  It gets heavy use.  It has never had any sort of problem.  If you want to get rid of your money have a bonfire rather than buy Apple, at least it will keep you warm!

title: I get more out of the dog in the neighbors yard then the person apple!!!!
text: I would not refer my worst enemy to Apple. I don‚Äôt even know where to begin. Let‚Äôs just start with the Apple IDs!!! I tried my trusted email and I logged in to that and it turns out it‚Äôs not trusted but it‚Äôs on my account. Apple prompted for me to try the credit card on file and it‚Äôs the credit card that I use daily that is sitting in front of me. Put in the numbers, expiration date and security code and low and behold the security code is wrong. No way possible! I‚Äôve had the same numbers and security code forever! The only thing changed was the month of expiration date. With that being said I cannot access my account. Contacted Apple support those people are useless. I get more out of the dog in the neighbors yard than the person at Apple support!  I have had the same Apple ID for going on 15 maybe 16 years now but considering going to android. I don‚Äôt hear of people getting hacked through android software, also I don‚Äôt hear people of getting locked out of the account and they have to wait five days after they were told that in 24 hours you can access it by Apple, Information doesn‚Äôt get released by accident like with Apple. I‚Äôm just all-around dissatisfied, disgruntled,  disappointed, with Apple. Most people work and some of them actually have businesses that calls for a working cell phone. I have lost clients due to this and you guys seem like you give a rats*** about our lives. You just keep pressing those buttons and stuffing your face with hohos and Debbie cakes! Remember you don‚Äôt have to wait five days! Hell you didn‚Äôt even have to wait 24 hours most likely. Karma is a beautiful thing!

title: APPLE WON'T SELL A PRODUCT TO ME - I've been trying for a MONTH and still unsuccessful
text: I've been trying to buy a macbook air FOR A MONTH, it's been the second time my order was canelled! For no legitimate reason! The first order went through, but then Apple cancelled my order with no reason. Apple states they could not verify my payment details, stating I did not contact Apple even if it was requested. However, I called Apple as requested! When I argued I called them they claimed it was my bank who cancelled the payment, which is another lie, because I contacted my bank and there was no issue from my bank's side. A representative stated I should receive my money from 5-7 business days because they cancelled the payment. However, they did NOT, as the money was back on my bank account not earlier than after 10business days!    When placing the second order, I couldn't even pay with the same debit card! I tried to place the order online, then via phone with a representative and once again they stated the issue is with my bank, which was only ANOTHER LIE. I called bank straight away and they claimed they couldn't see any payment coming from my debit card, they were certainly not blocking anything and my bank advised me the issue must be with the website. SO I had to place the second order from with a different debit card. Then they required a card holder's Driver's License/ National Identity Card/ Passport AND A recent Credit Card/Bank Statement displaying the cardholder's name, address, and card number, to verify the last 4 digits of the card number. I've tried to get this bank statement displaying the last 4 digits of the card number, but I was advised at 2 UK banks, there is NO SUCH A STATEMENT so they cannot provide me with one. SO I sent what I had and called Apple (waited for MORE than 1 hour to get a represenative on a phone), explained I don't have such a statement and they told me it's going to be OK and that I just need to check e-mails for updates. Yesterday they sent me the same e-mail that I need to send them the documents so that they can verify and proceed with the order. Moreover, it was stating I had another 6 days till it gets cancelled. Today I received an e-mail that my order was CANCELLED! This has been the worst experience EVER! I wanted,really wanted to buy mackbook but this has been the worst experience and I can't now imaging dealing with their customer service if any technical issues would arise. It's impossible to get anybody on phone and even though you get to somebody on phone they won't give you relevant information and won't help you to proceed with the order! I've now contacted my bank several times for this same issue and I've called appl at least 5 times and STILL I don't have any product and need to place ANOTHER ORDER???

title: Soldered HDs lead to environmental pollution
text: I think that in terms of environmental concerns, Apple tops the list of the worst companies out there.  Their sick idea of soldering hard drives to their machines' motherboards (here I am talking about their laptops, iMacs and Mac minis)  will result in perfectly usable units being thrown away (and pollute environment) when the hard drives die (and no matter what they die sooner than computers).  This, of course, will lead to more forced sales (long live Apple's greed!) unless the potential buyers begin to smarten up and to get the more environmentally friendly and easily expandable PCs.  I have no words to express how disappointed I am with a company I supported for thirty years through thick and thin.  Quite simply, they forced me to go over to the dark side, which in fact is not so dark.

title: Terrible after sales phone service.
text: Had to go into hospital, downloaded some stuff on new iPhone 8. No effing headphone port! My fault, I hadn‚Äôt seen the new headphones in the box that plug straight in. I phoned Apple. The woman couldn‚Äôt understand my pretty standard accent so she hung up! Phoned again. I was asked several completely irrelevant questions which I was told I had to answer before she could answer anything. She politely directed me to said headphones still in box. I told her I couldn‚Äôt use Apple earphones as they‚Äôre too big and fall out. She was polite about that too. I asked what alternative there was but she didn‚Äôt know.  It all took about thirty minutes. Phoned EE store where I bought my phone. In two minutes the assistant directed me to a lightning adaptor which I got immediately off the internet.  Why are Apple so hopeless? They give off such an air of polite professionalism but they‚Äôre really unhelpful. Why do they need my email address to answer a simple question? Why do I have to go into settings and fiddle with my phone just to get a small bit of simple information from them? And why is their ridiculous post trauma survey all about the assistant‚Äôs demeanour when it‚Äôs the whole process that‚Äôs miserably sub-standard?

title: Apple updates and why you should avoid them
text: My advice - DON't buy Apple products because Apple are an unscrupulous, company that will rip you off at every occasion. They are far too powerful, wield far too much financial and legal clout and  are getting away with fraudulent T+C policies every day. I had an iPhone 4s, old admittedly but working OK for what I needed. One day it offered me an update to ios 9.3 which in all good faith I accepted as I could improve on some of the apps I had. The update failed and this effectively killed the phone because the process erases the current ios. Solihull could not restore it because "it was an old version and not restorable any longer".They did give me technical explanation and were apologetic, and interestingly, the member of staff said if he hadn't got his working uniform red T shirt on, he could tell me things about Apple that would shock me. I therefore suggest that, because Apple have a database of EVERY phone ever made, they can see which ones are older, and then offer an update that they know wil fail, thus destroying your phone, and leaving you in the position of having to buy a new one. Well, F*k you Apple, I am not going replace with an iPhone ever. So, everyone beware of updates, they could destroy your phone. Solihull also said that when buying an Apple product, you automatically agree, in the T+C's that updating may damge the device, so they can  deny any liability for damage that occurs What a scam!!!!  To all readers, have a look at the Alan Moore video about Apple stuff.

title: Apple trade in not worth paper written on. Solihull staff utterly useless
text: Apple Solihull are utterly useless. Their trade in policy is total garbage. They are unhelpful, rude and badly trained. Clearly there is a serious training issue and management should be aware. We spent over ¬£2,000 just prior to Christmas on Apple products, but will now be returning these all and switching to Android. The machine I wanted to trade in is in pristine condition yet they refused to take it, citing some un-evidenced point about there being spots on the screen. These have actually now disappeared since I wiped the screen over at home. Perhaps they could have checked that in store instead of being so unhelpful. As one of the biggest companies in the world, Apple are certainly quick to take your money, yet the arrogance and unhelpfulness of their UK retail staff is appalling. You‚Äôve just lost a lifelong customer. This will be escalated until I get a satisfactory resolution.

title: History with Apple macbook, imac & iphone.
text: Since 2010 I have paid Apple $18,100aud and this has been my experience. For background I own & operate an IT business that covers office setups, repairs, creative design, marketing...etc. Not a noob, definately annoyed. I'll list these newest to oldest: - Macbook 2019 16" (max spec): Endless bugs and issues related to the T2 security chip, including restarts, freezes, screen glitching and audio popping. All to do with T2 doing things the intel chip is meant to and Apple haven't developed it properly....yet. These bugs are with all the machines. Unsuable in a professional setting and looking online there's waves of returns already. Mine's 3 weeks old and all I've done is debug it and get value out of my AppleCare+. $7000aud - Macbook Pro 2016 13" (no touch bar): 2 keyboard replacements (one in first 2 weeks) with light use and device clean as possible, hardly leaving the house. 2.5 years after owning it, Apple issue a recall for a faulty battery. I visit their website, serial is part of the faulty batch. Book it in for replacement, refused as "it was fine". Battery expands a week later, Apple remove serial number from serviceable devices and tell me they won't touch it. Supplying me with a factory defect then a staff memeber taking it upon themselves to decide my machine is fine cause it looks clean without testing cost me a computer. Thanks Apple. $2500aud - iPhone X 256gb: Touch screen issue on purchase, instant replacement. $1800aud - iMac 2015 (mid spec): LG screen ghosting issue within 3 months of purchase. Leaving anything on screen over a minute results in image burn. Have had to resort to making the screen turn off after 10 seconds, so not a desktop with stuff displayed all day as you'd expect. Lol. $4000aud - 2011 Macbook Pro 13": Battery expansion after 1.5 years of use. Cracked logicboard, useless computer. $1800aud - 2011 Macbook Pro 15": Given to me for free by friend, had the AMD GPU desolder problem and wasn't working. Coincidentally, Apple issue a recall for the problem in 2015, 4 years after the problem. Booked in a macbook I never bought for a free replacement logic board and it's still working to this day. How pathetic is that looking at the above history. Replacement logicboard & GPU on a macbook I never paid for, for free, but Apple refuse me for products I've actually paid for and know the history of. $Free -iPhone 4: Screen peeled because Apple used the wrong glue for Australia. Had to wait a month for replacements with correct glue. $1000aud This is just my experience. Literally every Apple device I've bought has had or does have major issues. Failure rates must be pretty high for one individual that runs an IT business and generally knows how to maintain these devices to run in to so many issues.

text: this new ios update actually just messed up my phone. i have a screen time limit where i cant go on apps after nine but i was always allowed to call/face time my parents and friends in case of an emergency. my phone would not stop telling me the update was going to install and this morning i woke up to it installed which i thought wasn't a big deal. when it was pass nine i went to call my mom and the call wouldnt go through and it just said this contact isnt allowed. i showed my parents and they have no idea what is wrong because they didnt chose any contacts to not accept calls. this phone is about to make me pull my hair out. now if i need to call someone if im in trouble, i cant thanks to this stupid update.

title: Beware of Apple and their terrible‚Ä¶
text: Beware of Apple and their terrible customer service! A few weeks ago I bought a refurbished iPod for my son for Christmas. I found a good deal directly from apple, which made me feel confident about the purchase. A few weeks later I realized that I had not received it yet. When I looked into it I realized that somehow they had pulled an old address from somewhere and sent it there even though I had entered my current address as the shipping address! I called Apple and was told that they were sorry, that the old address was substituted for the one I entered when ordering because I had used Apple Pay. I was then informed that they would send another to the correct address this time. Today I received an email saying that they were not going to honor that promise. I spent more time on the phone with another rep at Apple and was told that Apple Pay automatically inserts the address on file as the shipping address. I have since gone into Apple Pay and the only address I see there is my current address, not the one that they used. They are offering me no solutions aside from suggesting that I go to the house it was delivered to and ask them for it. Here‚Äôs hoping that they are honest people, and that it wasn‚Äôt stolen from their porch, which is where the courier says they left it! I will never deal directly with Apple again! Their inability to admit their own mistake and make it right is appalling! I did a little research and found that I am not at all alone in this experience. So beware!

title: I ordered an Apple Watch
text: I ordered an Apple Watch, on December 16, 2019. Apple offered a same day delivery but because I ordered at 8:00 pm, my delivery was scheduled for the next day. I noticed, after I submitted my payment, that they never gave me a time option. I work during the day and wouldn‚Äôt be home to sign for the package. I checked my email and the time was scheduled between 10-12. I contacted Apple, around 8:40 today, and asked for the delivery time to be changed. The agent stated that she couldn‚Äôt do that and offered to cancel the order. I asked her for a supervisor and she left me hold for a long time. I hung up and of course no one called me back. They canceled my order and now, not only am I out of a watch but I have to wait 3-5 business days for my refund. These money hungry people could care less! I am reporting them to the better business bureau because I feel like their customer service is horrible! They‚Äôve lost a customer forever!

title: Less than stellar customer service/online sales
text: Let me begin by saying I own several Apple products with no technical issues with them that couldn't be resolved easily. I have also been in the local Apple store and received good customer service. The issue that brings me here today is the poor customer service and online sales experience my mother and I experienced.  On 12.7.2019 my mother ordered 2, 38mm series 3 Apple watches from Apple.com.  They were scheduled to be delivered between 12.16.2019 & 12.18.2019.  Yesterday, I checked the order status and the order still showed in process.  I contacted customer support and was told they could see no issue with the order, placed a ticket to sales support and it should get the ball rolling.  Mind you, these were Christmas presents that needed to arrive before 12.24.2019.  At 5:15pm on 12.16.2019 I checked the order status again.  This time it showed CANCELED! I contacted Apple support again.  Spoke with a gentleman, explained what was going on and he stated that sales would have called to verify the purchase but if they couldn't get ahold of my mother or myself, it would have been canceled.  I received no call, email or any other message from Apple prior to speaking with them yesterday.  I explained this to the CSR on the phone.  He said he would "seek out a manager" but it may take a little while.  I waited.  I was on the phone, and on hold, for 1 hour 40 minutes WAITING for the CSR to "seek out a manager" before the manager finally picked up the call.  I'm not convinced they didn't do that on purpose.  In the meantime, I contacted my mother and told her to go to Best Buy and purchase the watches because Apple dropped the ball. I spoke with the manager, explained what I was dealing with and he apologized with very little remorse from what I could tell.  I told him had I not checked the order it would have left my mom missing 2 presents come Christmas because Apple didn't bother to communicate.  He stated he would check into it.  He also mentioned that sales should have contacted my mom to verify the order.  I explained to him no one contacted either of us.  Between them not doing what they were supposed to and leaving me on hold for 1 hour 40 minutes, this was a less than pleasing experience with Apple staff.   I see great potential for learning opportunities for the CSR and Sales teams.

title: Brand new Beats Studio 3 wireless‚Ä¶
text: Brand new Beats Studio 3 wireless headphones, maybe a week old. I've had these headphones for about a week now and they won't fully charge. I put them on the charger for 8 hours and woke up in the morning and they're still not charged. They also advertise 22 hour batter life with active noise cancelling on and 40 hours with it off. However, this only works if you have an iPhone with a W1 chip and I have an android phone. So after spending $400.00 on a pair of headphones that are supposed to work as advertised right out of the box, I'm expected to buy an iPhone for $1500.00 to get them to work. I filed a complaint with customer service and they're answer was send back my brand new headphones and they'll send me a refurbished pair. This is their tactic send back your headphones and they'll send you back a used pair that you can no longer return so they can keep your money without fixing the issue's. When I filed the complaint I asked if I would receive a call back and they informed me that I wouldn't receive a call back and that my complaint would be sent to their engineering team aka sent to the garbage with other complaints. Apple is the worst company in the world to deal with, they try shady tactics to force people to buy their other products rather than building a consumer base on the strength of the quality in the products they make. They find shady ways to force you to buy products you don't want and don't need that don't work properly, shame on you apple. I will never buy another apple product and this one is going back to the store.

title: Applecare+ theft & loss protection terrible process
text: Apple sold me there theft and loss projection as an upgrade to applecare+. The promise is you can get a new phone next business day if you have to claim. THIS IS NOT TRUE. I lost my phone on a Friday. Spent 2 hours in the apple store on Saturday. Turns out you cant log a claim without authenticating to icloud. But with two factor authentication you cant do that unless you have another apple device, which I don't. The only solution they could find was to change my phone number, to my wife's number, so I start that process. The store told me it would take 24 hours.  Sunday I check status, and the site tells me I have to wait 7 days, before I can change the number, before I can file a claim, without a mobile phone. Monday I went to the apple store, and the business team were great. We cancelled the new number request because there is no way of speeding that up (which the other apple store in city had steered me wrong on this). They spent a lot of time getting creative.  I had to go to the ATT store to change my security setup, then back to apple. The only path forward was to buy a phone from the store that I would later return, do a sim change, then I could authenticate, and then file the claim. In all now pushing 5 hours on this. I file the claim Monday lunch time. Three hours later I get a request for ID apples provider Assurant for verification. I upload my id photos (which I have used with instant success on other sites) an hour later.  The next day I call Assurant and they say there is information that needs to be verified, and this can take 2-3 days from when the claim is filed. They had no information on what the problem is. I call back after 3 days from filing the claim, and they told me exactly the same thing, only now they have reset the clock so it will be Monday or Tuesday. So now it is looking like despite purchasing protection insurance, I will be without my phone for 10+ days. This service is a rip off don't buy it.

title: Poor customer service in regards to issues with iPhone X
text: Apple removed this message from the forum... * Ive had this issue with my iPhone X since I purchased it in July 2018. I addressed the issue when I returned from holidays in November. They ran tests, completely reset my phone and even changed the speaker over 2 visits to the Apple store (2 hour drive away). I contacted Sarah in Feb and she never responded to my calls or emails. Ive recently contacted Apple again and they have not helped me. These senior Apple advisors included Dan, Caleb and Shanky... again, all of who disappear after contact. Ive even tried to return it to Officeworks (where I purchased it) and they dont have a loan phone while they send mine off for diagnostics and repairs. Apple want me to do another diagnostic test, even though they have 2 from November and a video of my phone playing up. Apparently this isnt enough proof. I will upload the video to YouTube at some point over the weekend. * Search 'iPhone X message notification distortion iOS 12.2' on YouTube and you should find the video. Latest diagnostic test today showed nothing. But clearly, as shown here, there is a fault in the software. It's disappointing Apple remove messages from people who speak out about the issues and level of customer service. Hence why I'm posting my Apple review here... not on their website. title: They don‚Äôt care about customers, only their bottom line
text: After being a lifelong customer of apple, I purchased an iPhone X and a couple months into owning it, it would no longer power on. I then purchased a second apple device as a replacement for the meantime, and took the damaged one to the apple store, where I was told since it was still under warranty I would receive a new one in its place. He also mentioned that if it did happen to have water damage, I would have to pay $349 to have it replaced. It was sent to apple repair and they found that it did have water damage (even though it had not come in contact with water, and it is heavily marketed as water resistant) and that now I would need to pay $549 to have it replaced. I called ‚Äúcustomer service‚Äù to ask about this, and was told there was nothing that could be done, I needed to pay that price even though APPLE was the one that misquoted me, because prices are published online. I dont know about you, but when I walk into a store and receive information from a professional at that store, I don‚Äôt expect to then have to check against that ‚Äúprofessional‚Äù. Of the 10 years I have been an apple customer, I have not once sent my phone in for a crack, liquid damage or other issue I have caused... but the one time I do, and receive false information from them and question it, I am told there‚Äôs nothing that can be done and I should‚Äôve checked online for correct pricing. On top of that, I was told the phones are not water proof, but water resistant (yes I understand there is a difference) so it was my fault... mind you, I‚Äôve had this phone for about 3 months at that point and had not come into contact with water. I would say i think they are confused about what resistant means, except their customer service seems to use resistance as their motto when it comes to ‚Äúhelping‚Äù loyal customers. While $200 may seem trivial, it is less about the difference and more about the complete lack of help and blame they‚Äôve placed on my shoulders with issues that were created by them. I have learned my lesson the hard way and will not purchase an apple product again... not that that matters to them as they‚Äôre raking it in anyways and it‚Äôs only the bottom line that is of importance to apple.

title: Terrible password reset process
text: ƒ∞PhoneX was my first iphone, which was recommended due to its face ID and password protection, as well as possibility to find in case the device is lost. My iphone was stolen on 16th Nov in London, after which I reported the issue to the police and then try to use Find My application to find where the telephone was. However, as I was panic, I forgot the password after which the adventure started. I visited Apple Store with my Macbook to find an easier and faster way to reset the password, but multiple experts along with conversations with Apple Support via phone tried the same thing I did and at the end of 2 hours, nothing obtained. The day after I requested recovery via Apple Support, where I was told that it will take a few days. I thought at the end of 2-3 days I could set new password and track my iphoneX. I received an email 4 days later stating that my request was accepted and recovery process initiated. I cant find any word to say. The term "a few days" was used to provide their opinion on recovery request, not finalization of password resetting. Now I received another email stating new password can be set on 15th December. Thief already destroyed, used or sold the phone; hence this extremely long and unnecessary password recovery is not in favor of the consumer, but the thief in my case. Almost 1 month after the case, what will I do by resetting the password?

title: A Kr.25,000 MacBook Pro worth nothing‚Ä¶
text: A Kr.25,000 MacBook Pro worth nothing after three months, do you still believe in Apple product? I bought the MacBook Pro from Apple .com/dk which delivered in 21 August 2019. Less than 3 months down the road, the laptop was unable to turn on, a complete blackout. Since Apple .com/dk didn't have a store in Denmark, I have to bring the laptop to Humac. A few days later, I went to collect my laptop, they said they couldn't find out what's wrong, all they knew was that it was a factory defect, therefore, "they have changed almost everything inside". A MacBook Pro which is less than 3 months old was found with factory defects, they refused to replace the computer. You would think an item which cost 2 to 3 times the price compare to other laptop at the same quality level would have a better quality control, but no, they don't care. I contacted Apple customer service in Denmark, was told by Thomas (who didn't dare to give his last name) that they can't do anything about it. I was the fool who spent Kr.25,000 for a terrible quality laptop. Apple may be 'fashionable', and think they can get away with bad quality products and services. Isn't it the time that we all wake up and demand Apple to improve its product quality and services level and be reasonable with their overpriced tag? Many people have experienced bad quality products and services from Apple, those comments from Trustpilot are only a small portion of unsatisfied consumers.  Matt from the USA who have spent more than USD10,000 on Apple product has initiated a movement to encourage those unsatisfied customers to join him moving away from Apple products. Too many people have been held 'hostage' for the sake of 'fashion' and suffered bad quality of Apple products. Do you really want to spent hours on sending those bad quality apple products for repair, live with the inconveniences without a phone/watch/laptop/computers for days, and take time again to collect it back just to find out the repair wasn't good enough? Moving away from Apple products, your time is precious!

title: Apple - Rotten to the core
text: Apple are a shadow of their former selves. They used to have a no quibble repair or replace policy. They are happy to sell products with known hardware and software issues but not happy to repair or replace anymore. They expect the consumers to pay additional money to get repairs done or pay extra for either a refurbished unit or pay the full amount for the newer series incarnation, which also has its own set of hardware and software issues. title: I'm definitely going back to PC now
text: I'm definitely going back to PC now Day after I was in a car crash, I was laying in bed, blind in one eye and not able to do much, but scrolling on my MacBook. Suddenly I hear a pop noise, and I'm instantly concerned. They start repeating, and I see my charger has started sparking! I hop out of bed, despite being in agony, and manage to unplug it before it catches fire (which would have probably caused my bed to burst into flames). I call Apple support and they agree that there's probably a safety issue and set up an appointment with my local Apple store.  After getting there 10-15 minutes early for my appointment, and waiting over 15 minutes beyond that (watching groups of up to 4 employees just chatting and hanging out), I get a guy from the "Genius Bar".  His "Genius" idea? Stop using my charger (duh) and pay $80 for a new one.  Side note, this is not the first time one of my chargers broke for a Macbook. After the first time, I listened to all the advice on how to keep my charger from breaking and followed it. Back when I had a Toshiba computer, my charger lasted 7 years, and that was through middle and high school when I was way more chaotic and disorganized. Did not have a single issue. It seems Apple likes their chargers to break within a year of moderate use. Their prices are 100% because of brand renown, not any sort of actual quality. If their products were put out by any other company, they would be seen for the hunks of junk they really are.

text: Terrible! After Sales Support!  So easy to buy right? But wait till you have a problem....you won't be able to even send them an email about it. Despite spending a day trying!!! ---- To Apple  I cannot believe I purchased this iMac only 3 years ago for almost USD 3000 Each year it has gotten steadily worse and worse with Mac updates. Right now I am typing this on my phone as my machine won‚Äôt even start! I spend hours each day and get nothing done due to the system which keeps hanging. Need to verify what I am saying? No problem. Let‚Äôs set up meeting. Happy to lug this machine to your store to take a look.  The experience with Apple has been steadily deteriorating over the years. title: iPhone Run Around
text: I preordered an iPhone 11 Max Pro online prior to September 20th. I got it shipped to store, and it was available for me when it was finally my turn to enter the store. I received the phone just fine, but here‚Äôs where things took a turn for the worst. The customer representative asked if I backed up iPhone 8 Plus data to iCloud (which I had not, my mistake). I was using this as a trade in as it was in good condition and I was to receive $300 of credit for my new phone. The representative told me to save my data and to return the phone the next day. I did that only to find out that the representative that helped me the next visit, told me he couldn‚Äôt scan the phone because it was a web order and I was to receive a trade in kit in the mail. So, I return home and call Apple support,  and another representative says I do not need a trade in kit, but to bring the phone back to the store for a credit! So, once again I‚Äôm back at the Apple store and yet again the representative tells me it‚Äôs an online order and I should receive a kit in the mail! I call Apple support while in the store and the representative that I spoke to told me she would send the kit to my home. I wait for quite a few days but by this time Apple cancels my trade in and charges my card $300. I call back after about a week of not receiving the trade in kit and after noticing that they took money from my debit card. The representative that I spoke to this time told me that the prior representative spelled my address wrong and I should get the kit in a few days along with an email confirming the trade in kit being sent out. Well guess what? Of course that didn‚Äôt happen! So, I call again and this time the representative tells me that I can take the phone into the store, trade it for a gift card, then call them back and receive a refund for the $300. This didn‚Äôt sound right but I was willing to try just about anything. So I head to the store, yet again, I actually get the gift card. I then call Apple customer service, once again, and was told they can‚Äôt do that and I would need to speak to a supervisor! I was on hold for over an hour! 1 hour of waiting! I finally was pushed through but when I was asked to give my name I responded with ‚ÄúI‚Äôm I speaking with a supervisor,‚Äù the response I preordered an iPhone 11 Max Pro online prior to September 20th. I got it shipped to store, and it was available for me when it was finally my turn to enter the store. I received the phone just fine, but here‚Äôs where things took a turn for the worst. The customer representative asked if I backed up iPhone 8 Plus data to iCloud (which I had not, my mistake). I was using this as a trade in as it was in good condition and I was to receive $300 of credit for my new phone. The representative told me to save my data and to return the phone the next day. I did that only to find out that the representative that helped me the next visit, told me he couldn‚Äôt scan the phone because it was a web order and I was to receive a trade in kit in the mail. So, I return home call Apple support and another representative says I do not need a trade in kit, but to bring the phone back to the store for a credit! So, once again I‚Äôm back at the Apple store and yet again the representative tells me it‚Äôs an online order and I should receive a kit in the mail! I call the Apple mole support while in the store and the representative that I spoke to told me she would send the kit to my home. I wait for quite a few days but by this time Apple cancels my trade in and charges my card $300. I call back after about a week of not receiving the trade in kit and after noticing that they took money from my account. The representative that I spoke to this time told me that the prior representative spelled my address wrong and I should get the kit in a few days along with an email confirming the trade in kit being sent out. Well guess what? Of course that didn‚Äôt happen! So, I call again and this time the representative tells me that I can take the phone into the store, trade it for a gift card, then call them back and receive a refund for the $300. This didn‚Äôt sound right but I was willing to try just about anything. So I head to the store, yet again, I actually get the gift card. I then call Apple customer service, once again, and was told they can‚Äôt do that and I would need to speak to a supervisor! I was on hold for over an hour! 1 hour of waiting! I finally was pushed through but when I was asked to give my name I responded with ‚ÄúI‚Äôm I speaking with a supervisor,‚Äù the response was ‚ÄúNo, what you want a refund?‚Äù In a rude tone, I told her no and that I wanted to speak to a supervisor, she said ‚Äúwait while I put you on hold to read the back story of your call.‚Äù Then placed me on hold without my consent. I promptly hung up the phone. I‚Äôm finished with this situation, it‚Äôs a shame that not one representative could get this rectified for me! Beware, make sure you back up your phones so these will not happen to you!

title: Beware: iPhone Pro Max 11 glitches
text: Out of the box my new iPhone Max Pro 11 did not work. According to Apple reps the issues are "software" not "hardware" related. The catch, Apple doesn't apparently warranty their own software like they do their own hardware. 2 weeks have gone by and Apple is continuing to point me to work with AT&T to resolve it and AT&T is continuing to point me to Apple. (I purchased the phone through AT&T - big mistake I'm now learning is to never purchase a phone through the carrier as apparently this broken tech passing the buck thing happens all the time between the carriers and the manufacturers). Apple worked on the phone for over 3 hours and with no ability to fix it (AND, that was on day one before it ever powered up fully!!! However, it appears neither Apple nor AT&T seem to really care about fixing it as they're just letting the 14 day return policy run out so it falls back on me as the consumer to have to resolve it with my credit card company. Doesn't seem fair to me that my credit card company is going to be the one who has to pay for a replacement for a brand new phone that never worked properly from out of the box.  Be warned about glitches with the new iPhone 11 Pro Max and how AT&T and Apple are not owning up to it.

title: Apple Music no good
text: I am fed up with Apple Music. I thought things would fix themselves when I upgraded to the new app but its just the same. I have been having problems with iTunes for years where, basically my music doesn't sync properly with my iPhone. I have spent over 50 hours over the years on the phone with Apple where they screen share my computer & try and help me. They never put me onto a music expert who may be able to assist better. They have tried everything but the stupid system doesn't work. My playlists keep changing, music keeps disappearing & the playlists don't sync properly with my iPhone. I also have iTunes Match, which Apple don't support very well as they want you to go to Apple Music. I own all my own music so I don't want Apple Music subscription. I am going to have to totally change platforms, so if anyone else knows a better music platform where I can take all my music & start again, let me know. Apple just can't fix this problem.

title: If I could give 0 stars I would
text: If I could give 0 stars I would. I am first of all NOT an apple user, I do not have an Iphone nor use iTunes. I do not know why I am even registered on their website? But the story tells, I received a charge one day last month on my visa card, of 8,99 Euro. I thought it was a mistake by a friend who had sent me one of his songs to listen to, and blamed it on him. 2 days later, I received another charge, this time of 27,99 Euro. There I got angry and contacted Apple, spoke to a CS rep named Eden. After emails back and forth explaining the situation, she refunded me for both transactions and admitted that she can see i didnt buy anything and that I was in fact not a customer of them. NOW, I received another charge of 100,37 EURO last week!!!!!!! I contacted Miss Eden straight away and this time she tells me: It could be a charge from a family member or a friend using your details (still how would that be okay for me to pay for, its theft!), it could also be an old transaction charged now (no, i was never a customer) and she want me to call a security team which the line doesnt work. I am swedish and live in cyprus. the line speaks in greek only and cuts off after the person finishes what they say. I have now let Eden know again I am not, have never been, nor will ever become an apple user and that my card has been blocked by my bank and I will proceed with a formal charge back if she doesnt help me refund the money. THIEVES THAT IS WHAT APPLE IS!!!!! 3 TIMES THEY HAVE CHARGED MY CARD, FROM A PERSON WHO DOESNT EVEN USE THEIR SERVICES. I can understand a transaction here and there of 0,10 Euro. from millions of customers can be unrecognizable, but around 10, 30 and 100 euro from a person who doesnt even use their products... what the hell apple?! Youre such a huge company anyway, there is no need to steal from people!!!! Oh by the way, I was also unemployed until last week, on my second day at work this happened. Apple took all of my money I had left in the account. Now I had to borrow money until I get paid...

title: Recently made a purchase from Apple
text: Recently made a purchase from Apple,  buying iPad AIR. There was an option to trade in old device and I decided to use it. Went over questioner and established price was $120. I did take care of the iPad mini4 , never dropped. Good working condition. After a while I received email that trade in price changed and it's now $0. Reason "Something with screen or Battery". I cancelled trade in , was sure iPad is in good condition. I received my iPad destroyed , they pulled out sim card, software  installation was sloppy (missing items). I could not connect to Wi-Fi. Called support received "sweet talk" and quiet after this. Writing this as warning . I made a mistake and regret it now.

title: I'm absolutely horrified at how poorly‚Ä¶
text: I'm absolutely horrified at how poorly I, an over 20 year Apple customer, was just treated in the Boise Apple store. I've used Apple products personally and for my business for as long as they've been in existence. I had the original iPhone when it was released, I had the original Apple 2 as a child, the first Macintosh in college. I was expecting to trade in my iPhone as I'm enrolled in the upgrade program but was told I couldn't because my Verizon plan disqualifies me as it's not a contract plan. Why would I get a contract plan I don't need as I'm getting a phone elsewhere??? This was confusing because when I started the program I was on a month to month T-Mobile plan and what was communicated at the time in that store a year earlier was I only need to stick with T-Mobile, ATT, Verizon, or Sprint to be eligible for an upgrade, which I did. So the initial sales girl trying to be as helpful as possible got the floor lead and she, instead of trying to work things out, started off insultingly curt, disrespectful, and with an attitude that I was somehow the enemy and didn't belong in there. I will think long and hard about buying another Apple product again, I cannot support a company that treats its loyal customers so poorly and doesn't stand behind its agreements. Its shocking really, I guess Apple doesn't care about its customers anymore. There are plenty of options out there these days, may be time to put Apple in the rear view mirror I suppose, without integrity they deserve no loyalty. In my view Apple has precious little integrity left.

title: Purchased iPhone 7+ in fall 2016
text: Purchased iPhone 7+ in fall 2016.  Brought into Apple Store in St Louis, West County Mall for battery replacement in Aug 2019.  After 3 hours, was told something happened to phone during battery replacement but that Apple would be giving me a "new phone."  Nothing but problems with phone since replacement. Found out that phone was not "new" but actually a "Service phone" or refurb.  Internet not connecting properly, then speaker/speakerphone/microphone stopped working.  Called Apple (twice), went to Mac HQ(twice) ATT (once @ Apple's request for SIM card replacement which was useless) and finally Apple Store (three times).  On the last visit to Apple, after numerous tests and 2 hours was told phone was defective - obviously- and that it would be need to be replaced again and that I was within the 90 day warranty (as opposed to the 1 year warranty which comes with actual new phones).  Then rep returned with another "new" service phone, peeled of the plastic, tried to connect, and then announced there was a "problem" and returned to the back of store.  Returned and announced that the phone could in fact now not be replaced and that it would now have to be returned for service.  I explained that I had simply come in for a battery replacement and that this was a ridiculous waste of my time and asked to speak to Store Manager.  Another manager returned and stated that there was "nothing they could do" and that I could either leave the store with the defective "new" phone or send in for service.  After much pleading, I said to send it in if that was my only option. This has been a tremendous waste of my time through no fault of my ow and is a problem created by Apple Store during a simple battery swap.  What was originally a simple battery replacement has turned into a nightmare.  I have spent close to 3 months and 30 hours in talk, drive and wait time dealing with a defective phone that I did not ask for; this was originally, 3 months ago, supposed to be a simple battery replacement of my existing, functioning phone. Apple has been disruptive.It is obvious to me at this point that Apple is simply trying to get me to purchase a new phone after already spending nearly 1200.  It is also apparent that the "new" phones being used in these situations are anything but.  After having all of my time wasted, promising a replacement phone and then suddenly withdrawing the offer, being sent on fruitless wild-goose chases and resets, etc etc I would like a refund of the original purchase amount and a new iPhone 11 512 GB as a replacement.

title: My iPad Air 2 stopped charging
text: My iPad Air 2 stopped charging. Online advice was to do a hard reset while plugged in. That worked for about two weeks and then stopped. I mad an appointment to bring it in and did on Oct. 7. The tech took it in the back and when he came out told me that I needed a new battery. I was given a choice to either buy a new batter for $99 or I can trade mine in and get a new one for $99. Not wanting to reinstall all my data, I opted for a new battery. But then I was told that there really wasn't a choice. I had to trade mine in and get a new one but he did not have any in stock.. two days later I picked up my new iPad.  Within 4 days it stopped taking a charge. I made another appointment and brought it back to the Apple Store on Oct. 17. The tech tried different ways to get it to take a charge but nothing worked. Then she  told me that she would have to "completely wipe it clean" and reinstall all the software. I told her I had an appointment and could not stay. I asked if she could just replace it with another iPad but she refused. I left with the iPad. I do a hard reset every time need to charge the battery.

title: Apple is Scamming People!! A MUST READ!! I foresee a lawsuit heading Apples way!!
text: I would give them a ZERO star however it would not allow me to do so.  Apple is a JOKE!!  This WILL be the last phone or product I EVER purchase.  They are ripping people off.  I work hard for my money.  The year warranty of the iPhone is JOKE!!  My device XS Max screen went black all the sudden.  After researching this it appears this has become common with this certain device.  It even has a name... ‚Äúscreen of death‚Äù.  Your device is done. It says it‚Äôs caused from a black light malfunction.  I purchased my device 5 months ago.  I‚Äôm 45 years old.  I take care of my phones.  I purchase a device and it stays in the case with a screen protector.  I was informed to take my broken device to the Geek Squad at Best Buy due to no Apple store close to me.  They looked at my device and I was informed it wasn‚Äôt caused from physical damage - water or liquid damage caused by me.  They said it‚Äôs a malfunction with your device and it will need to be sent to Apple for possible repair or replacement.  I was informed 2-3 days and I should hear something from Apple or Best Buy with the results of repairing my device or replacement.  After day 8 of NO phone I called Best Buy to see if they have heard from Apple.  I was informed Apple needed to speak to me and they should of been attempting to reach me.  Note-  I did NOT receive one call or text OR email.  I called Apple and they informed me my device showed indications of ‚Äúliquid‚Äù damage and it would not be covered.  I needed to pay Apple $650 for repairs.  I was furious.  I informed them there was NO way it was caused from ‚Äúliquid‚Äù damage.  They insulted me by calling me (pretty much a liar)!  I asked them for proof of the damage and was told they could not show me proof.  I informed them if it was caused from liquid damage an indicator would show the damage.  I asked which indicator showed this and they could not give me that information.  WOW APPLE!!   What great customer service you have.  I‚Äôve performed extensive research on this and from what I‚Äôve gathered this is common with the XS Max with the black screen of death and it‚Äôs NOT caused from liquid/water damage.  It‚Äôs a back-light malfunction.  I informed them of this.  Told them to google this.  It‚Äôs all over the web.  Of course they disregarded what I was saying and pretty much said I could pay the $650 for repairs or they could return my broken device.  I told them to just send me my device.  I can promise Apple this.  I‚Äôm NOT done!!!   I will be contacting the Attorney Generals Office and making sure they are aware that Apple is cheating people out of their hard earned money.  I work hard daily for what I have.  Shame on Apple for this.  I have several of your products but this will be the last product my family and I will be purchasing.  I will make sure I inform everyone of the poor poor customer service and scam Apple is doing and making sure (hopefully) this is stopped.  I foresee a HUGE lawsuit in the near future!!!   I hope Apple gets everything that comes their way for cheating people who work hard for what they have.  You pay high dollar for something you expect your product to last longer than a few months.  You should be ashamed.  I‚Äôm sure Apple doesn‚Äôt want to replace several devices due to a malfunction so they will just say ‚Äúliquid-water‚Äù damage and it‚Äôs not covered by the factory warranty. I‚Äôm hoping I will be able to file a claim with AT&T insurance and Apple can stick their products where the sun don‚Äôt shine!!!!!!!!!

The following morning I went to the iStore in Dizengoff Street in Tel Aviv to confirm that the disabled cable was my problem or was it my iPhone itself. I had 3% charge, all charging options having failed. The first assistant allowed me to try an Apple cable in my phone. It started to charge. The second assistant refused to allow me to connect my phone to my mobile charger unless I paid 120 shekels to buy it first. I had no choice but to do so. title: Daughters iPhone X crashed after IOS 13.2 update
text: My daughters iPhone X worked perfectly before crashing after installing the latest IOS 13.2 update. After calling the help desk I was advised to connect it to iTunes via my PC to resolve the issue but it would neither update 'or' reset the phone. A fault code of 4013 kept coming up. So I booked it in and I took it into an Apple store this morning where I was told there was nothing they could do as the software was knackered unless we coughed up ¬£500!  The question is, who takes responsibility for any glitches in the updates that are potentially fatal for the phone?  The phone was purchased on a contract that I eventually paid off in full. Now I own the phone no-one will do a thing to help, fix or replace it and its not even 12 months old.  The staff member in the Apple store was so blunt, dismissive and uninterested in my problem. It appeared he was only interested in trying to get me to part with more money, attempting to upsell me to the new iPhone 11. I hasten to add my daughter 'doesn't want' the new model. She wants her beloved iPhone X or a replacement. I am disgusted with the performance of a so-called flagship model phone, the after sales service, the fact it was the update that appears to have crashed the phone and not anything my daughter has done and the fact no-one is prepared to help. It would appear Apple are just happy to see my daughter go without leaving her non-contactable in an emergency.  The whole service from Apple has been deplorable. Getting through to the help desk takes up to 30 minutes. The service advisor will keep putting you on hold (more minutes taken up) and then he doesn't call you back when he says he will to check if the update has worked. The whole experience will take about an hour out of your life that you will never get back and will only be a waste of your time anyway.  This is a blue chip, premium brand company where the customer should be made to feel they really matter. Today I haven't and I've been made to feel that all that matters is taking more money off me because of a faulty devise, made that way by a fault in their own IOS update. World domination in the mobile market is all that seems to matter (either that then its commission on their sales) and customer care has become very much secondary.   My daughter is left without a phone and I am left massively out of pocket. Shame on Apple.

title: Absolutely dreadful non-service
text: I recently sent an iPhone 6 for a replacement battery to the Apple repairers in the UK, Unipart. The cost for this was stated to be ¬£56.44. Unipart tried to charge me ¬£246 plus VAT maintaining that there was damage to the simcard holder of phone. I requested that the phone be sent back, as it had been in excellent condition when it was sent to them. It arrived back yesterday, same 'no damage' condition and working perfectly apart from needing a new battery. Therefore either Unipart has tried to defraud a customer or they are totally inept. Apple's response to the issue has been awful - the adviser in the USA put the phone down on me today. He wanted me to travel to another authorised 'repairer' 40 miles from where I live, in order to have it confirmed that there is no fault with the simcard holder. I tried to make him understand that I would not be able to make calls etc if the simcard does not work but he just did not want to know. So rather than investigate the ineptitude or fraud of the service at the Apple UK repairers the attitude of Apple seems to be to disbelieve the customer and ignore the fact that their repairers are dreadful Now I have a phone still in need of a replacement battery. The screen protector had been removed, which would not have mattered if the battery had been replaced. However, when I asked the Apple rep if they could provide a replacement screen protector in view of what has happened that was too much for him and the phone went dead.

title: Apple retail store Brent Cross have the worst customer care
text: I had the worst experience ever with Apple retail store in Brentcross. When I took my MacBook Pro which was in working order but needed support in updating its software to a new version, the technician was trying to discourage me to do any updates and promoting a new purchase which I was to consider soon but my visit was to make sure the software upgrade was done successfully. He said it will take 45 minutes which I said ok. Then said he needs to run a test to make sure the hard drive was ok which he came back and said in perfect condition and is ok to do the software update. However when he tried to run the update it failed. Then he said only other way will result in all memory loss. I agreed to that since Ive done a external backup recently. unfortunately that also failed. Then the technician said there seem to be a problem with my hard drive and he's going to take it to the back and do something to it. After about 20 minutes he come back with a dead computer saying my hard drive was bad and now they can't do anything and I should take it to some computer repair centre and replace the hard drive. I was so shocked at this. I brought a perfectly working laptop and now he's handing over to me a broken laptop saying nothing can be done. If he told me initially there is a risk of my computer going bust I would never have let him take it to the back and bring back a lifeless laptop. When I refuse to just accept it his attitude changed. Then I asked to speak to the manager oh boy why did I even ask for him. Manager or the individual who claimed to be the manager was the most arrogant rude person Ive ever come across in my entire life. I have by now wasted about 3 hours waiting and about an hour going through this horrible experience and to be told tough this is all we could do. He had no idea about customer service. He said this is a free service and they do not have to do anything else. He even refuse to listen to my side of the story. He said now its broken and we cannot do anything about it. Offered me no help or reassurance. He practically chased me out of the store saying theres nothing else he could say. When I asked how to make a complain he said even of you complain it will only come to me and I will chuck it away. I could not believe this answer. Here I am now without a laptop which I need so badly for my work and being asked to leave simply because he said he can.  He refuse to give his name and his staff member who served me. I asked them to then give me in writing what happened to my laptop and that they recommend I take it to a repair shop and replace the hard drive. I told them I prefer to do it with apple for warranty purpose they refuse to take that in too and insisted I take it to someone else saying that will be cheaper. All this asked to be given in writing and they said they'll send me an email which to date I haven't received.  We pay such a big premium to apple simply because we believe their customer support is good. However apple stores which suppose to help their valuable customers have no idea what customer service is. I have been a loyal apple customer from inception. There was a time apple had such amazing customer service but now it is unbelievable.  I was so upset and was almost in tears. When my 16 year old son saw the state I was in he got one of his friends to come and check the laptop and he restored the laptop and manage to do the software upgrade too. I cannot believe what the apple technician was trying to do. He must have thought I would buy a new MacBook. I can't think of any other reason why they said my Hard drive was bad. I would never ever go to that Apple Store in Brent Cross ever again. I will reconsider going forward wether I want to stick to apple products anymore. If this is how ordinary loyal customers are treated. We seek assistance because we are simply not the experts in technical stuff.  Apple should really train their staff about customer service.

title: Fraud Repair
text: If I could rate this zero stars I would, I got in contact with multiple people at Apple about repairing my Beats headphones. I payed extra for a warranty that they did not follow up on. What they did was literally illegal but there is not much I can do about it which is just a gross misuse of power. This has been by far the worst experience I have ever had with a company in my entire life. They constantly told me I was ok and that headphones were gonna get fixed but that of course never happened. They then said I lied about the damages which was not true and that I specifically damaged my headphones in order to get a new pair. Hopefully this sounds as ridiculous to you as it does to me. They then sent me an email saying the damages were beyond repair although there was only two minor problems that could have easily been fixed. They then sent me an email saying that the only way I was going to get back my headphones in a better condition is if I payed two hundred dollars plus tax to get a new pair. This company is abusing their power and lying to their customers. I was also told that I would be getting a call or email to follow up on this but that also never happened. Now I just got another email saying they are shipping back my product without repairing it. So I payed two hundred and twenty dollars for a pair of headphones that lasted less than six months and a fraudulent warranty. This company is an atrocity when it comes to customer service, absolutely nobody knows what to do when you ask for help. I will never be buying from this company again and I recommend you do the same.

title: I purchased a series 4 gsm apple watch‚Ä¶
text: I purchased a series 4 gsm apple watch which Apple advertise as being water resistant to 50m (it even comes with a swimming app) 11 weeks after purchase I got caught in the rain and the watch died, no problem took it back to the Apple store only to be told water damage is never covered under warranty  So basically its advertised as water resistant but not warrantied! It's my understanding this applies to supposedly water resistant apple phones too!! A quick Update after contacting Apple Support and speaking to a senior adviser Apple have now replaced the watch under warranty so for anyone in similar position if you feel justified escalate it, don't accept the Apple Stores arbitrary decision So I've Raised my score from 1 star to 2 on the basis Apple resolved it but really this should have been a straight forward warranty calm dealt with by the store!

title: I will NEVER buy another Apple product again
text: I filed a claim with Verizon about a damaged phone. Tried ordering a replacement as claim suggested and was told I must turn off my Find My Phone before placing replacement order. I could not remember my Apple ID Password so I contacted Apple Support on  9/21 to assist me. I was given a claim # and told that I will receive an email within 3 days. NEVER received an email. Called on 9/24 and spoke with several different people saying that we will have to again wait for another 3 days and no one could rush this. After speaking to the 4th person on 9/24 he let us speak to a SENIOR REPRESENTATIVE who asked us to send in Proof of Purchase, Receipt, etc so that they could remove the device off the account to expedite us in getting my replacement phone instead of waiting on recovery. Sent in after a week (9/25)  the required paperwork to have the device removed from account. Today (9/27) I call to make sure they received the information they requested and see if the device has been removed off account and I'm being told the Senior Rep I spoke to on 9/24 told be incorrectly and there is nothing she can do to speed up the recovery process. I will receive a call or text on 10/21 when the account is ready to recover. WHY does it take 5 WEEKS to recover my password? I am a single parent with 2 kids and using a phone that was given to me to me as a favor (older Droid Turbo) but I am missing phone calls and text messages. I NEED MY REPLACEMENT PHONE ASAP!! Apple is dragging their feet and doing nothing to make this a priority!! I will NEVER buy another Apple product again! This is beyond insane and ridiculous!

title: To be honest

After spending 2 days trying to fix my old phone I gave up and bought a brand new iphone X plus.  The set up process for this brand new iphone X has been hell, as they are requiring me to upgrade to this crappy iOS 13 as part of the set up process and it is taking hours... hours that I dont' want to spend.   On top of this they added 2 party authentication to my account, and did not give me the option to skip, but the only options to authenticate use my phone which isnt even activated yet. I really hate this company and their attempts to play "mommy" with security and the forced obsolence of the technology.  I encourage all of you to complain to the FTC and justice department, break up the Apple Trust

title: Never buy an Apple product without‚Ä¶
text: Never buy an Apple product without knowing how Apple control how you use it. I have an iPhone and a provider contract with 20Gb a month of cellular data. I just bought an Apple Watch, but it is unusable. The reason is it needs iOS 13 and my iPhone has only iOS 12. But Apple doesn't want me to download the system update. I can only download it through WIFI and not using cellular data. But 1) I am away from home and have no WIFI access, and 2) I have WIFI at home at 5 Mbps when I have 200 Mbps 4G access, and 7.8 Gb remaining on my monthly contract that will expire tomorrow.  So be aware that you might by Apple product, but you can't be sure Apple will allow you to use them.

title: Don't go to Best Buy for an Apple Repair!
text: Apple is positioning Best Buy as a seamless service option.  DO NOT GO TO BEST BUY TO GET YOUR iPhone SERVICED!  If you go to the Apple Store, they fix or replace instantly.  If my experience with Best Buy is typical, they do not fix.  They simply send out.  Do you have 4-7 days to go without a phone???  They were willing to replace, but they didn't have it in stock at the location I went to, a location I made an appointment with through the Apple web site.  So that Best Buy sent me to another, that supposedly had it in stock.  But after searching their warehouse, a process that took 1.5 hours they told me they did not have it in stock EVEN THOUGH they were selling them.  Then it took 30 more minutes for them to call around and now, I'm going to a third location tomorrow.  .  I'm now 3 hours in and have no phone. Clearly Apple is more interested in CLAIMING they have expanded support and Best Buy is interested in getting people into their stores FAR MORE than either is interested in actually helping!  And clearly neither values customer time!  I'm getting increasingly fed up with Apple's pricing, lack of innovative offerings and you have no other choice so deal with it attitude.  This will be my last iPhone - a shame...

title: Unloading your old stock on consumers!
text: I bought an Apple Pencil in 2016.  I used it for a bit but didn‚Äôt find it all that useful, and put it aside.  Recently I found an application I like that uses it, so I took it out, only to find that it no longer charges, has difficulties pairing with my iPad, and doesn‚Äôt work.   I called Apple support and after two lengthy conversations (they lost all my records in between), it was agreed that for the sum of ¬£32.44, they will send me another one, and I am to return the old one, or, failing to return it, will be charged in full for the new one.  Fair enough. Except, when the receipt for my payment actually materialised, what it said was that if Apple decides that the old one cannot be repaired. they will also charge me the full amount.  No option of return, and no specification of what counts as unrepairable. I called Apple (for the 3rd time), and was told that the clause is to guard them against items that have been damaged through misuse.  However, they did not agree to give me this information in writing.   Altogether, then, it all looks like a ploy to force me to buy a new pencil - of an older generation- without any return options, and against the background of the present one having failed inexplicably.  Why would I want to buy another specimen of a device which after such a minimal use has already failed? Why blocking the option to simply return?   Way to go, Apple!  Download your undesirable stock in those who were stupid enough to buy your products in the first place! This, in addition to the logical board on my MacBook pro that collapsed after 6 months and took 6 weeks to repair, and my IPhone 8 with a battery life that doesn‚Äôt last a day.  I am winding down my Apple devices.  The MacBook Pro is gone, and these are my last iPhone and iPad.  Other than design, Apple doesn‚Äôt seem interested, anymore, in anything like technical quality, or decent consumer support.

title: Fraudulently Charged for a Spotify Account
text: It recently came to my attention that for 55 months I have been double charged for my Spotify account. Back in 2015 when Spotify and Apple split, I transitioned my Spotify Prime billing over to Spotify because it cost me $10.91 whereas Apple charges $14.19. At this point in time, my Apple Spotify account was downgraded to a free ‚Äútrial‚Äù account and I was no longer being charged the inflated premium. I‚Äôm only now realizing, 55 months down the road, that once that trial period ended, Apple began charging me for my account that had previously been canceled with them. They chalk this up to a ‚Äúuser agreement that states that once a trial subscription has ended, you will automatically be charged for the premium account‚Äù. I have never once received an email regarding these charges. The total charges for these 55 months amounts to $780.45. After 4 hours on chats and on the phone with Apple employees and supervisors, I was told I would be credited $28.38. This is pure fraud and theft. I was never notified of these charges. After reading multiple forums and threads from others experiencing this same issue, I have reached out to a class action lawyer. He will be investigating this issue further. I plan to update this thread as we look into suing Apple. Stay tuned and share this thread if you know of others who have been taken advantage of in a similar way

title: Issue with Apple
text: I'm frustrated and annoyed with Apple. I have a iPhone 7 and it had an issue. Apple was not able to fix a simple issue. I spent hours at the apple store in order to get my phone fixed but they didn't resolve my problem. My phone kept saying "No service" or "searching" so we went to the apple store as soon as the problem came up. We spoke to one of the representatives but she said she couldn't fix it because she can't locate what the problem is and that it may be a problem with Verizon or with my campus. I go to college and it's been an ongoing problem where I couldn't call or text. Then, we went to Verizon, our carrier, and asked them what the issue is. They said it was the phone's problem. So, Verizon fixed it temporarily by switching the sim cards but the problem occurred again which is when they knew it was a phone issue.  Apparently, after Apple issued an update, it's been causing the same issues on the iPhone 7. Yet, Apple disregarded that point and told us initially that they can't pinpoint the exact problem as it could be due to Verizon or a blackspot on campus.  What frustrates me even more is that as an apple supporter and buyer, apple didn‚Äôt give us other viable options to fix my phone. The only two options they gave us was to use a loaner phone which I had to pay just to send it in or trade in for a new phone.  On top of that, I spent three weekends coming home to fix my phone and ended up buying a new phone. The amount of time I spent on trying to fix my phone made me lose the time I could have spent on anything else. If apple can create top technology, why can't they figure out an issue caused by an update? Apple is pushing updates that is making the phones that work well to not work such that they can increase their sale of new phones. I believe business can be done better than this.  My family is a big apple supporter, or at least was until now. We have three iPhones, a mac, an iPad and a tablet. Apple disappointed us entirely now making us question where our money will be spent from now on. We believed in Apple's quality but we are losing trust.

title: Its been 2 years since I bought my‚Ä¶
text: Its been 2 years since I bought my iPhone X. Being a content creator I really need a good and durable phone with great photo and video camera. Not only the camera, the display also plays a very important part in getting the right click and also helps us to colour correct accordingly. The os experience is so smooth that it offers zero shutter lag and also have a telephoto camera which helps in creating a depth effect and along with that I can zoom in 2x times without loosing picture quality. The price which I paid for the device was around 84k. I know it must sound so expensive for a smartphone and I could have bought a good camera for the same price but portability plays a very important role in a life of a social media influencer who is always on. So after 2 years of aggressive use I can say that yes it was worth an upgrade.
