title: Buyers Beware!
text: I used to love Apple products and have been an avid buyer for the last decade (multiple iPhones, MacBooks, iPads, beats and an Apple TV). My most recent experience has made me never want to purchase another product. I purchased a MacBook Pro in 2012, which wasn‚Äôt cheap, but when spending $2100 on a computer you would expect it to be quality. Boy was I wrong. The laptop all of the sudden would go to a gray screen when turned on and wouldn‚Äôt load from there. I looked up the issue online and found that this is a common issue with the 2011/2012 model of the MacBook, and Apple actually faced a class action lawsuit in 2014 over the defect, in which they offered out of warranty replacements from 2015-2016. When I brought it to the Apple store they ran a diagnostic test and confirmed that it was the defective video card. The Apple Genius informed me that the company considers my laptop obsolete and they no longer make the part so there are no options for repair. He immediately recommended that I just purchase a new laptop. Why would I ever want to buy another MacBook from a company that considers the device obsolete after 5-7 years and won‚Äôt even fix it if you pay the out of warranty repair price. All buyers beware any Apple product you own will be considered obsolete 5-7 years after release and will not offer any repair options after that point. There used to be a time where they would repair any model of any product but those days are long gone.

title: Team iPhone!!
text: Date of experience:   April 08, 2019

title: Verify YOUR Phone if it new or‚Ä¶
text: Before you sign; verify if you are a getting a New phone - not a trade in. Match the serial number to the box they hand you. I was tricked into thinking I was buying a New IPHONE.   A reasonable assumption when you point to the display case where the phones are shown and tell the Apple CS rep that you just want to replace with the same style IPhone. YOU are led to believe that you are getting a NEW Iphone not  refurbished one. Here's what  the AppleCS representative did to me. She told me she needed my phone to transfer my data to the new phone. She has me sign on line - what I missed in print was "new or refurbished", She then transfers the information in the back so you don't see them opening a new box. Then she walked out and handed me a new box with someone elses serial number and new ear plugs. I didn't think much about it because they are handing you your purchased phone and a new IPhone box.  So naturally you think you're getting a new Iphone. Very misleading. There's no sticker marked telling you it's a trade-in refurbished phone. viewer site. The sales person was super sweet and knowledgeable so I trusted her advice. . She had me sign online for my receipt and as a normal person - you scroll through several pages to accept. But In small print what I signed was the comment  new or refurbished. I would have never bought a refurbished phone. I was expecting a NEW PHONE. I didn't catch this until a few months later  I noticed the serial number didn't match in my phone.  When I tried to resolve it by contacting the Walnut Creek Store - they hung up on me, they put me on hold till I finally gave up holding. I also tried to resolve it on line with  Apple support and they could care less. Basically, I was blown off by the CS supervisor because I signed on line.  I would have never, never, never, never dreamed I would point to the phone shown in an Apple display case and have an Apple representative walk out with a NEw  IPHONE Box & Earplugs that tdidn't match the IPhone I was getting. I wasted a lot of time getting no where.  I finally gave up.  My recommendation is ALWAYS check your phone before you sign online to see if it's actually brand new and that you're not getting a trade in refurbished one. Shame on Apple. Now I better understand why the  CS representative said she could dispose of my damaged IPhone. Now I know what they do, they use your damaged phone and refurbish it and sell it to someone else. Just appalling. In retrospect, I should have gone to the CBS or NBC"news" where they help you when there has been an unresolved problem.

title: I am prefacing this review by stating‚Ä¶
text: I am prefacing this review by stating that I am not angry or upset about my experience with Apple.  My review is intended to hopefully enlighten others on what I have learned. I had an iPhone for 3 years, and I am just not impressed like I used to be (before I had one).  The main reasons are as follows: i) way over-priced; ii) indirectly promotes/causes ADHD in people; iii) promotes wasting time; iv) they break WAY too easily; and v) customer service is not great at all. Don't get me wrong, I enjoyed my iPhone while I had it.  I dropped it ONE TIME and it broke.  I am a dumb phone guy; had one for many years before I relented and followed the mainstream crowd and getting a smartphone.   I've since gone back to my dumb phone and I enjoy i) peace and quiet without notifications; ii) the ability to concentrate on any task without feeling a desperate, addicted tendency to pull out my phone (MOST people are like this with their phones anymore; it's sickening); iii) an increased ability to appreciate face-to-face communication, among other better forms (than texting, social media [it's anti-social media, really], etc.); iv) financial savings; v) better time management (and more time spent actually living); and vi) many more that I will not include, because you should get the point now.

title: I have used apple for all of my college‚Ä¶
text: I have used apple for all of my college career. I am currently a Masters student and require very reliable technology. Apple used to be great. In October I upgraded to their newest MacBook Pro with the Touch Bar 1TB storage. 4 months into the new laptop, I already had to get my board and Touch Bar replaced. Okay, fine. They replaced it and I received my laptop back 3 weeks later (2weeks later than they said it would be done). Fast forward a couple weeks later, I update my software on my laptop (because you know how apple makes you do that) and I lost vital files for my graduate school coursework. Turns out, there is not a back up file for my iCloud within my laptop hard drive whatsoever. I have purchased and pay monthly for extensive iCloud storage to prevent this issue. I even backed up/restored files from the icloud.com files. The person that helped me made it very clear that this was just a screw up on Apple's part but they refused to help me to replace my computer or give me a refund. This is the second screw up with Apple in one month and I do not recommend their customer service or new products. I will be switching.

title: I would like to tell you the horrible‚Ä¶
text: I would like to tell you the horrible experience I had with Apple. Two weeks ago my husband and I went to the Apple Store in Marlborough Massachusetts because his phone was broken. we were told that there was no way to fix the phone, and they gave him a new phone. at the time of leaving the store, I asked the agent about all our photos and videos. He said that would do it automatically, and even when my husband informed him that the photos did not automatically go to iCloud, he insisted that we could go home, because in this case Apple "compacts" the photos. we believe him, and we left with the new phone. title: Brand New Apple iMac 5k ¬£2,300 - Flickering Screen (they will ignore you)
text: Contacted Apple regarding my Apple iMac 5k and they don't want to assist in repairing the faulty iMac. I've taken it to an Apple store on several occasions for the same issue and they are telling me to sell the faulty iMac and buy a new one. I've been in touch with Apple head office but they don't want to assist in fixing the flickering screen. I've sent them several videos showing the intermittent issues experienced. Once the screen starts to flicker the only fix is to power off the iMac using the power button and therefore losing everything. Apparently I am not able to exercise my consumer rights because my faulty iMac was replaced due to the previous one also having a faulty hardware component. I will have to now contact my card company to file a charge back claim and then take this matter to court. on 31/10/2018 filed a complaint with the European Commission and Apple rejected the claim and responded "We will contact the customer directly to review the feedback with the purpose of agreeing a resolution where appropriate. Apple Distribution International" Following this I had a response from Kashif Jamil Executive Relations EMEIA  "This is to acknowledge the receipt of your email. I am fully empowered to make decisions on behalf of Apple for any service and support issues. I have reviewed your situation and provided Apple's position. There is not further escalation point or department who will handle this complaint or provide a different answer at this time". They are bunch of rude, arrogant and ignorant people that don't want to assist when things go wrong. Taken over ¬£2,300 of my money for a product which is not as described, of a satisfactory quality and fit for the purpose. They have breached the Consumer Rights Act 2015 and the only way they will adhere to this is if you take them to court.

text: Sorry that there is not a less than 1 Star for the EarPods.   $160.  First time on treadmill.  I go to get a cloth to wipe the machine and someone steals the charging case.   FU Apple for giving me no option other than buying a new charging case for $139.    Can I find my case? Nope.  Can I GPS my case? Nope.  Can you do anything for me?  Nope.  Cuz you need the case to charge them so you have to have it with you.   But anyone can take it in 2 seconds flat. And Apple doesn‚Äôt give a crap.  Hey.  That‚Äôs mother $159.   The first and last time I buy your crappy solution to music.   Your welcome for the other $15,000 grand In computers, phones and TVs for 4 kids, 2 parents and 2 grandparents that I convinced to buy your stupid products.  At least you got your $159 from me.   Give me my money back for the EarPods or lose my business with the 7 folks I brought along.

title: After 6 years my iPad 3 was still‚Ä¶
text: After 6 years my iPad 3 was still working and still got updates until late 2016. But last year the iPad broke after dropping it.

title: IF I COULD GIVE A NEGATIVE 10 FOR THIS‚Ä¶
text: IF I COULD GIVE A NEGATIVE 10 FOR THIS REVIEW I WOULD. I bought my husband an ipad 2 years ago for Christmas. He died 6 months ago. I sent his iphone back. I don't have his ipad passcode. Finally after 2 weeks I got someone who helped me get connected to itunes to reset. I am still locked out because he had a 2 part authentication. I just got off the phone AGAIN and am told I have to wait for the reaunthentication team because no one else can help. I provided proof of purchase 2 weeks ago. Now am told I need to prove I am the executor of the estate. Rep says that I missed the 3 hour window to reset the passcode. They were supposed to text me with instructions but never did. Now I am supposed to check in 24 hrs to see if they responded. Horrible service. No one to talk to who can fix this.

title: Apple products have gone unmatched‚Ä¶
text: Apple products have gone unmatched since they have entered the industry. It is non-arguable that its technology is innovative and exceptional among all other brands. As I type this on my MacBook, with an iPhone in front of me, an Apple Watch on my wrist and an iPad in the other room, the only thing keeping me from a great review is one thing that Apple has most often failed at. Customer service.  Over and over millions of purchases happen at Apple. And over and over, they are hidden from the public eye after the purchases have been made. They have perfect responses on how to tell you "we don't do that." I do not mind a "no" when I am out of bounds on requesting too much of a company or requesting something they simply cannot accommodate. When it comes to spending thousands of dollars on these products, they are quick to be smiling and helpful when your debit card is sliding. Right up until you need something in return. (A question answered, to speak to someone on a specific issue, etc.) Try to get in touch with an Apple agent. Find an email online for support. You will not easily find it (if at all.) They are completely inaccessible except for when you are making a purchase. I am not asking for much. But what I am asking for, is to acknowledge that your billion dollar company is held to what it is, because of the people on the other side of your screens. With our happy fingers, incredible Led and face recognition, we are left frustrated due to the irresponsibility with your taking care of customers. Apple we love you, but we wished you loved us back.

text: If I could give a zero I would!!!!!   What a horrible experience of being on hold with customer service for over an hour. I‚Äôve decided to never ever use Apple ever again!  Customer service Mariah wasn‚Äôt much help, just very condescending and also stated that the only way I could get an upgrade for a series 4 watch is if the watch shocked me.  This happens apparently???  Next time you have issues with Apple just tell them that the electronics shocks you, I‚Äôm sure they will listen then!!!!

title: If I could give zero stars I would
text: If I could give zero stars I would. I bought an Iphone a little less than two years ago (iphone 7). One day, it just would not turn on, I tried charging it and everything but nothing. I took it into the apple store, I was informed it was not going to turn on. The worker said iphone 7 was not a great 'batch'. I am now out almost $600. My husband has a 6 plus, and it is acting up as well. I will NEVER EVER EVER BUY ANOTHER APPLE PRODUCT in my entire life.

title: Locked out of Apple ID and there‚Äôs‚Ä¶
text: Locked out of Apple ID and there‚Äôs nothing they can do to help. It was created over 10 years ago and I can no longer figure out the security questions.  My only option for my iPhone was to show proof of purchase. Which I did and took it to the Apple store where they reset the entire iPhone. They forgot to mention that I should unpair my Apple Watch from my iPhone. Now I‚Äôm locked out of my Apple Watch and iPad as well. They said I can show proof of purchase for my ipad and get it reset that way. Which it was bought over 10 years ago at Walmart, so that‚Äôs going to be a hassle in itself.  As for the Apple Watch, there is nothing they can do as they don‚Äôt allow showing proof of purchase a method of resetting the watch. I am not able to use the watch at all unless I can figure out how to login to my Apple ID, that I clearly can‚Äôt login to.  I‚Äôve spent so much money on Apple products over the years and the customer service is no help. I know I am not the first person who has ran into this problem. I don‚Äôt understand why showing proof of my drivers license with the same name that is linked to the Apple ID would not be enough for them to unlock the device.  More money down the drain.

title: Apple Customer Service needs to provide SERVICE to their CUSTOMERS.
text: Update: I wore the broken apple watch for about six months.  It still worked but I got sick of looking at the cracked glass.  So I bought a Fitbit Versa Lite and it is fabulous.  Much better and 1/2 to 2/3 the cost.   But why I'm writing the update is that I found out Why the Apple watch dropped and broke.    The charger for the Fitbit wraps around the watch and clamps down so it won't fall off the charger.  That was the problem with the pretty white circle Apple watch charger.   It doesn't adhere to the watch and the watch can be knocked off the charger very easily.   A really BAD design Flaw.   It look great but works like...... Apple, you should stand behind your product.   Original review: Used to be a good company. Now a bunch of unaccountable, price-gauging, inferior product-making thieves.  -- my sentiments exactly. The Apple Watch series 4 is advertised as the ultimate sports watch.  My watch face completely shattered after the watch fell off the charging station, about a 40 cm fall.   Falling off a table at 40 cms  does not compare with wearing an Apple Watch while kick boxing, playing soccer, practicing martial arts or playing USA Football.  A sports watch, an expensive one at that, should not only stand up to the rigors of the above mentioned sports but also should survive a simple fall off a table. We purchased two Apple Watches for Christmas presents for about  $950 USD.  The watch face of a sports watch, especially an Apple product, should last more than 5-6 weeks.   We are long term Apple users and currently have 2 ipads, 2 ipods, 2 MacBook Air and 3 iphones, along with the new Apple Watches.  All these other products have lasted and survived the rigors of normal daily life. I requested that they replace the crystal facing and they said no.  I had to buy a new one.   Why would I buy a new watch for $400 if the first one broke in 5 weeks.  This is surely a defect in the watch face.  Something is wrong with the facing to crack and break after a small fall off the table. As a long term Apple customer I am shocked that Apple goes not care about customer loyalty.   They have gotten way too big.   I currently have the watch wrapped in cling wrap and when it finally dies I'm going to buy a FitBit watch for 1/2 the price.  And when I need a new phone I'm going to buy a Samsung--again for less money.   We do not need Apple anymore. Below you will see some of the advertising material that describes the Apple Watch.  This is what we read before we purchased the watches.   If the website had said, ‚Äú be careful, the watch is very delicate, don‚Äôt let it fall 40 cms‚Äù then we would have saved our $950. Direct quote from apple website: (With Boxing Video) Apple Watch Series 4 is more than just a sport watch.  It‚Äôs like a trainer that understands the ways you work out ‚Äì from running to yoga to swimming ‚Äì and puts every metric you need right on your wrist.  With innovations from start to finish line, it‚Äôs made for the athlete in us all. Whether it‚Äôs training for a marathon or swimming laps at the pool, Apple Watch Series 4 has something for everyone. Now including yoga and hiking, the Workout app works every way you want to exercise. You can set individual goals, measure your calorie burn, and track your progress over time in the Activity app on your iPhone. Ready? Go. Approved activities that the apple watch will track for fitness. (partial list)   Outdoor walking Yoga Strength Training Indoor Walk Outdoor run Outdoor Cycle Indoor run Indoor cycle Elliptical Rower Stair Stepper High Intensity Interval Training Hiking Pool Swim Open water swim Dance Kickboxing Cross training Core Training Pilates Badminton AUS Foot Ball Basketball Boxing Cross Country Skiing Downhill Skiing Equestrian sports Fishing Gymnastics Handball Hunting Lacrosse Martial Arts Paddling Racquetball Rugby Sailing Snowboarding Soccer Softball Squash Surfing USA Football Volley Ball Water Polo Wrestling

title: Pay for storage? iTunes deleting my music files... What the...?
text: Used to be a good company.  Now a bunch of unaccountable, price-gauging, inferior product-making thieves. 10 year product lifespan MAX (I'd say it more like 5 years now before your operating system will be obsolete).  That's ridiculous for the price. And they are overpriced.   Bad performance platforms that are cumbersome to convert to anything else.   Apple now loves charging extra fees monthly wherever they can. Horrible customer service.  HORRIBLE.  Rude, incompetent tech employees.  Any support person who seems helpful, forwards you on to the next unhelpful person who basically says they won't do anything the other guy said they would.   Oh and let's talk the scam of iTunes/iMusic.   Pay for my music monthly... and to download it... (warning: they will later delete what you paid to download at random). They just deleted things from my music library (playlists I'd had 10+ years) and are now trying to make me buy them back in iTunes (like hundreds of songs because I didn't initially buy them from apple music.  Yes, I bought those before you guys even existed... I'm over 35.) No accountability.  Rude, lying customer service reps.  Caught one saying "f you" to me right before he hung up.  (Because I insisted he let me talk to the previous employee I had spoken with vs. being forwarded to a third one. The current and intentionally misleading advertising that has everyone signing up for extra storage and iMusic because you can't access your saved documents otherwise (disc almost full-optimize storage).  How is my "disc almost-full" I hardly have anything on this computer/phone?   Oh, so I can buy iCloud storage. You know you who doesn't charge me a monthly fee to access things I paid for or to have adequate storage on the device I have.... any other computer company except apple! I'm going to the store today and going back to PC.  I'm done with this lying, gauging, and unethical company.  I'd suggest we all do the same.

title: I‚Äôve left Apple after 10 Years.
text: I‚Äôve always had Apple products since the iPhone 3G came out. Over the last several years Apple products just seem to be getting worse. I bought a new iPad a few years ago that had a huge yellow tint on the screen. I took it back to Apple who eventually replaced it, but not before unboxing 4 new iPads in the shop with exactly the same defect. More recently I upgraded from my iPhone 6 to the new iPhone XR. The screen on the new phone had a defect, it had a discoloured band going across the bottom of the screen. I took it back to the shop, and I bought the Samsung Galaxy S9 instead. The build quality from Samsung is much better than Apple, and there‚Äôs virtually no difference between Android and iOS now. I don‚Äôt regret leaving Apple after 10 years, I‚Äôve missed out on so much. Apple products are simply not as well made and reliable as they were many years ago. Now, Apple are just shipping overpriced, unreliable junk for teenagers and adolescents. I‚Äôd never buy another Apple product.

title: If you need a working computer don't come here
text: Tomorrow will be the third time I have taken my computer into the apple store in Birmingham for the same problem. The previous two times I was assured the computer was fixed, however, the computer has yet to function normally. The last time I took it in they sent it away and charged me $500 for repairs. When I got home it wouldn't even turn on... Now that it has turned on (miraculously) none of the keys on the keyboard work (this was not even an issue when I took it in). I am a graduate student who has now been without a laptop for over a week thanks to apple's incompetence. I deeply regret trusting this company with my computer. I wish I had gone somewhere else and bought a new computer when they suggested a $500 repair. I will not be buying any more of their products. Unfortunately, I am stuck praying they will actually repair it when I bring it in the third time as their incredibly high "repair" costs have left me few options. If you need a working computer do not go here.

title: Some apps are satisfactory but others are unsatisfactory.
text: While some of their apps for an iPad Pro are good and reliable, others are terrible.  They stop working, there‚Äôs no online help, and no support.  It‚Äôs a good thing they are inexpensive or free (but usually with annoying ads). It seems to me, the programmers are more interested in developing as many games as possible and putting in ‚Äòflashy‚Äô decorations, than making the apps robust, including sufficient inline documentation, and testing the apps with new iOS versions.  Their quality control budget seems to be fantastically low.   They don‚Äôt seem to comprehend that paying customers are the reason for their employment and that you can‚Äôt always work on what is the most ‚Äòfun‚Äô. My ‚ÄúText Read Pro‚Äù app no longer works no matter how many times I restart the app or reboot my iPad, so I just deleted what has become useless rubbish.

title: Richest company cheapest quality
text: Its weird that one of the richest companies can be so...terrible.I mean fair enough yes their products such as macs, phones and ipads are good.I Like my IPhone XR but Jesus Christ. Why make a phone without a headphone jack? i know this is old news but why not make a variant that has a jack? the xr is definitely thick enough. I saw a review that said it was to make it more user friendly. How exactly? By making everyone that buys a phone have to buy Bluetooth? or making them use earpods that have can only be used when not charging? the earpods make my ears hurt so i thought OK ill buy an adaptor and use my old earphones but has anyone seen the reviews of the official apple adaptors? i would have thought that by now someone at apple would have gone "hmm maybe we should make this product better so that people want to buy them. More importantly... if you go and buy a 1000 pound phone you get some terrible earphones. If people are spending that much why not give them airpods with the phone? or even the adaptor for the jack?(although the adaptor is trash). All you get in the box for an xr is the charger, the phone, the earpods and some paper. Im sorry but most people have headphones or earphones that have a 3.5mm jack. so whose SENSELESS thought was it to go "hmm lets get rid of that thing that is universal and most people have access to and instead make it so they cant use them. SURELY keeping it would appeal to more people and therefore cause more sales? So Many people don't buy apple because of the lack of a jack and i somewhat wish i didn't because it means i can keep using my phone when it needs charging and use any earphones i would like to or even never have to touch a pair of earpods again. Top tip-Before buying, ask yourself 'Do i truly want this?' Because it seems like im stuck for 3 years with a phone that honestly ruins music just because of the sole fact i cant use a decent pair of earphones. although the speakers on the phone seem good i cant really have songs blaring out at 2;14 in the morning. #BringBackJack OH by the way forgot to mention you are paying more for less literally... If anyone from apple reads this (HAHAHAHA NO) remake the 5c with more storage. it was small, works well, good quality,indestructible and HAD A JACK. id rather pay ¬£1200 for a remade 5c than 1200 for an iphone xs.

title: I have an iPhone 7 and a macbook air
text: I have an iPhone 7 and a macbook air, this combination is so convenient. Connection between iPhone and Macbook via iCloud is superb . i can directly pick up the call on my macbook air. :) Happy with Apple.

title: Terrible experience with customer‚Ä¶
text: Terrible experience with customer service and the iPhone 6s product. Bought the iPhones 6s in Alberta Canada in March 2018 , after few months screen stopped working, called customer service and they couldn‚Äôt fix it and they refer me to Market Mall Calgary, Canada Apple service centre. They looked at the phone and said it has hardware issue . They have to replace it in September 2018 and during that time they told me to wait for approximately 2 hours. After 2 hours they returned the phone to me. Worked for 2-3 weeks and then same issue. My wife threw this phone away. After few months again opened the phone as the warranty was about to expire it worked but this time software issue. Called customer service took it to store again. They said you have to transfer your data as we have to erase and set up new software. Returned home and transfer data . Went to store again today talked to the customer service. After listening my concerns he went and talked to the senior guy, who said may be they have to replace it. But again few minutes later they said we are recommending a replacement but we need to send it to apple depot to repair. So wait for approximately 2 weeks to hear from us. I had three trips (70 *3 km) and will have again after they call me plus additionally hour just going for this lemon product. Look like they give a Damn. Even the cheaper phone has better customer support than this. Have Mac and other I phone product but now seriously considering moving to others. Do something with your brand that you have build before it get killed.

title: Worst experience ordering online ever!!
text: I placed an order online and never received my product. When I looked online, Apple had cancelled my order. When I called customer service, I spoke with at least 5 ppl. Many of which I was disconnected from. Everyone told me that they didn‚Äôt know why my order had been cancelled. They couldn‚Äôt believe That no one had informed me. Then, finally I spoke to a manager by the name of Julie whom stated that it was cancelled because I used a debit card. Really!! Never heard of that before. It‚Äôs my same bank card that I use for everything that I explained to her. She told me to contact my bank. No compensation for my time lost with them. I then called back and spoke with someone else who told me again that there was no excuse or reason for what had happened.  He promised to send me some ear pods that I never received and told me to use a different card and try it again.  I then used my Amex card. Needless to say, my order was cancelled again without my knowledge and as of now my money is still pending on both cards. My bank is saying that Apple has to disregard the charges and Apple is saying that they have already done that. If so, why is it still pending on both cards!  I had never ordered anything from Apple online before and I never will again. It was the worst experience that I have ever had ordering anything online. There needs to be a zero star button because they aren‚Äôt even worthy of one star.

title: Need to Rant.....
text: This rant comes because of several bad experiences @Birmingham-Apple-Store and I have finally had enough of you and what you are peddling.  Apple may be one of the largest companies in the world. Unless you fix how shockingly bad you have become, this fall from hubris is going to hurt you, or wake you up.  I don't even find it pleasant to shop in your stores anymore, especially your flagship Birmingham High Street. The staff are only happy, if they are selling you something. Yet, most of the visits now are to fix something wrong with one of your products. You used to be great at service and even that (in my opinion) is mediocre at best now. Software bugs, security issues, a homepod that doesn't ship, yellow-gate, apple music is sh*te and deletes music, face ID fails, iOS 11 keyboard letter i doesn't work, antenna-gate, shockingly bad apple maps, battery-gate (that should have been a free replacement, not ¬£25! it was your pissing fault), slowing down my phone, bend-gate and an update every 20 seconds for a ¬£1100 phone. I've stomached enough!  Also, stop telling us about features you intend on releasing 4 years later, just so we are buying your Jony Ive dubbed videos. Get him out of the recording studio and back into a lab working, for F sake. ECG for apple watch 4 still isn't out in the UK, what are you playing at? You used to innovate, then you just followed others but made things properly, now you can't even do that. I, like others, had every phone and have spent tens of thousand with you. Now I will make sure, I never put another pound/dollar in your pockets again. For the first time in 17 years you have not met your forecasts for revenue growth ‚Äì and by a big margin. I hope this continues. Nothing, not even the wondrous success of the iPhone, lasts forever and can save you now. Rant over! Goodbye longtime friend. üñï

title: GUYS BEWARE
text: GUYS BEWARE! THIS IS A FAIR WARNING TO THOSE WHO WOULD WANT TO PURCHASE ANYTHING FROM APPLE STORE ‚Äì DUBAI MALL USING YOUR EMIRATES NBD CARDS. THEY CHARGED MY DEBIT CARD TWICE FOR A SINGLE PURCHASE, ON SEPARATE OCCASIONS, 2 DAYS APART AND THE UNAUTHORIZED TRANSACTION WAS ALLOWED TO PROCEED WITHOUT MY KNOWLEDGE, WITHOUT MY PRESENCE, WITHOUT THE CARD, WITHOUT ME ENTERING THE PIN CODE AND WITHOUT ANY SMS NOTIFICATION AFTER THE QUESTIONABLE TRANSACTION.   07 February 2019 Three colleagues joined me; I went to Apple Store in Dubai Mall to get a new phone. It did not take me too long to decide as to which specific model to choose because I have already made up my mind long before coming to the store.  Within a good 5 minutes after I walked in, a staff was already taking care of my purchase, took my details, the works. She immediately came back with the new phone unit on one hand and a card machine on the other (I decided to pay using my debit card). I have not really decided on getting the Apple Care warranty service but since the salesperson was kind enough to suggest it, I thought to myself ‚Äúwhy not?‚Äù and so I took it. I am aware that I can get that warranty until before the 60th day of my purchase but I trust the store (and the brand, sure). Looking back, I could have just paid them in cash instead of giving them access to my debit card. However, who would know that something bad is going to happen. I paid AED 6,129 for the device, an iPhone XS Max 512 GB Space Gray and AED 799 for the Apple Care. That is a total of AED 6,928 purchase done on the 7th of February. I was quite excited with my purchase, and everything was okay until after 2 days.   09 February 2019 I live nearby an Emirates NBD branch (Mankhool area) and in the late evening, I went to make a balance inquiry through the ATM. After which I noticed a difference with my account balance.  This prompted me to get bank statement the following day.   As per the bank statement, I was charged the amount of the mobile phone and the warranty, TWICE. First on the actual date of my purchase, 07 February; and the second was on the 9th (two days after). The questionable thing about the second transaction is the fact that I was not physically in the store to give them my debit card, more so, I was not there to enter my bankcard‚Äôs pin, and worse, I did not receive any form of notification (SMS) but my bank allowed the transaction. Have I not made a balance inquiry on the evening of February 09, I wouldn‚Äôt have noticed the change in my account balance and it wouldn‚Äôt have prompted me to get a bank statement.   11 February ALL 5 OFFICES IN A MATTER OF 8 HOURS, NOT TO MENTION I HAVE GRAVEYARD SHIFT LATER IN THE EVENING. Tell me if there is anything more frustrating than this!   I went to Emirates NBD Mankhool branch, and I was asked to fill out a dispute form. According to them, the problem started with the store‚Äôs (Apple Store Dubai Mall) machine as the transaction was initiated there itself. However, as to the question of how the transaction went through without me giving my bankcard, no PIN entry and no SMS, THIS THEY CAN‚ÄôT ANSWER.   I visited the Apple Store and informed them of my case and as from their statement, the bank was at fault.   (Great! These two, very unreliable establishments, pointing fingers at each other do not help the situation and is all the more increasing my already growing frustration.)   I made an online complaint to the UAE Central Bank website with Emirates NBD.   I went to the Department of Economic Development (a government agency that focuses on consumer rights).  I filed a complaint against the Apple Store, for double charging. According to them, it will take around 2-5 days to get a feedback.   I went to the office of the Dubai Police (within the vicinity of the Dubai Mall) and it is where I found out that similar instances has already taken place involving the same store. As to my information, there have been five (5) similar cases, more or less, on that day.   I also went to the Dubai Mall Security Office and in there, they have accumulated 5 different complains against the Apple Store in a matter of 3 hours, all happening at the same day!   12-13 February There is nothing I could do except wait and apparently, there‚Äôs nothing anyone can do about the situation.  This has cost me too much hassle, and by far the MOST INCOVENINENT thing that ever happened to me.  All I ever wanted was to upgrade my device, and all I get is physical (because I work night shifts and I can‚Äôt just go home and sleep because I had to go through all this mess), emotional, financial (I don‚Äôt keep an account just so anyone can easily take what they want, when they want!)   I am not in any way implicating any or both of the establishments involved, Emirates NBD and Apple Store at the Dubai Mall, but anyone can be a potential victim of this particular incident.  I have many questions in mind. What if this thing happened to a Dubai tourist, it is his last day in Dubai, and he does not have the time to go through all this mess? What if the person‚Äôs money is meant for something else, say for example, he is set to get his annual leave and about to go to his home country for a vacation, wouldn‚Äôt he need money to spend? What if there weren‚Äôt anyone giving him advice as to what to do?

title: Poor Apple service
text: I bought a macbook pro less than a year ago and have had nothing but problems and poor customer service! I recently was using my laptop, walked 150ft with it in my hands and somehow a huge black line appeared on my screen! I have never dropped, damaged or mistreated this laptop.. I have it in a hardshell case and carry it in a padded case and always have it in my backpack during travel. Everything on the laptop is pristine!!! Before this happened the laptop would overheat and shut off and not turn back on for awhile and get a fuzzy grey screen! When I took it in because it was still under warranty the apple genius bar not only had me wait 4 hours for a 10 minute appointment, but also is trying to claim that the problem is not covered under warranty. They are trying to tell me that there was impact or damage done to the screen, which is not possible as it was working 2 minutes before this random black occurred on the screen and no damage was done to it! The guy tried to tell me it could have been from something as small as a bread crumb getting into the screen or carrying the charger too close to the laptop! All BS to be honest. A 1400 dollar laptop that is less than a year old should not have these problems! Now they are saying the screen will cost almost 1/3 of the price of a brand new one !!!! I will never buy Apple products again due to the fact that they don't take care of their customers and the quality of their new products are not up to par for the price!

title: Seems by the reviews here I'm a minority....
text: I‚Äôve always purchased my Apple goods directly from the Apple website and have never had a problem with ordering or returning goods. The service I have received has always been excellent, technical support however is terrible, they are very nice and professional but don‚Äôt really know what they are talking about. I once had an issue with a Mac Mini not auto turning the monitor on after an OS update. They told me it was my monitor so I should buy a new one on their website ‚Ä¶ For 800 POUNDS! I later discovered that macOS High Sierra requires HDMI version 2 or later if you want to switch inputs on a monitor while the Mac is running. Still that‚Äôs miles better than MS support so I‚Äôd still give them 5 star rating just because they give a dam, which seems sadly lacking from today‚Äôs retail market.

title: Subscription services Scam
text: If you delete an app, you have to navigate 6 screens deep into the IOS settings for subscriptions not to renew on apps. I signed up for a "Free Trial" on an app, when I deleted the app and deactivated my account, I was charged 4 days later for the subscription a total of 60$ charged to me for an app that wasn't even on my phone, when requesting a refund, the request was not even considered and within miliseconds of "putting in a request for a refund" the screen says "Sorry, you do not qualify for a refund" or something along these lines. AKA not being clear about what one must do to cancel a subscription cost me a large portion of what the phone is actually worth. I have since cancelled every subscription based service I have on my phone and will not be purchasing anything ever again. I refuse to do business with a company who intentionally profits off people's lack of knowledge on their product and deliberate attempts to make it as easy to accidentally spend money as possible. This is the only online review I have ever posted in my entire life if you want to know the scale of mad this made me.

title: Rude and racist Apple store managers at‚Ä¶
text: Rude and racist Apple store managers at Union Square San Francisco (Liz and Mike) I had the worst customer service experience ever at the Union Square Apple store today.  I went in to see about getting my defected charging iPhone cable replaced (the plastic coating at one end was peeling off which is sadly quite common not only for iPhones but MacBooks as well). I spoke to one of the store managers (Liz).  I explained to her how I've been a loyal customer over the years and that I had over 15 different iPhones to date (yes sadly over the years and over the different generations of iPhones).  I told her that I really believe this cable is defective.  I even pointed out to her how good quality looks like by pointing to the headsets on her associate.   Liz pretty much told me that there is nothing she can do for me because it's considered "wear and tear" even though this is from an iPhone XS Max that I recently got. She offered no other options and pretty much shut me down.  I asked her to pull up the limited warranty statement on the Apple site that speaks to this.  She asked another store associate read out to me something that doesn't speak to this all.  She couldn‚Äôt find or point to any supporting statement and just tried to brush me off.  Then she proceed to recommend me to buy another cable from another brand (yes she did) saying that if I didn't like the quality of Apple cable. Doesn't it sound ridiculous?!! Saying the Apple product is quality on one hand and refuse to stand behind the brand and then recommend me to use a better quality product from another company!!  I explained to her that Apple is a multi billion dollar brand and I am trying to help provide feedback to corporate so they can improve their quality. I pointed to her black headsets (they all wear that in the store) saying that type of material is good even with "wear and tear" and that Apple consider using it. She responded "don't touch me".  I was just simply pointing to her headsets. Another example of her not being empowered, sympathetic or listening to the customers.  All her focus was on fighting with me and not taking my feedback or concerns. Then I asked for her name, she wouldn't give me her full name. I asked for a business card. She pretended to go grab one but never came back. Another manger named Kevin approached me (must have been sent by Liz) and started talking over me and saying a bunch of stuff like he was reading it from a book and then proceeded to tell me that he would kick me out the store and get security if I didn't stop recording what he was saying (I told him that I was broadcasting our conversation).  He then kept talking loudly over me and kept calling me being disrespectful yet he kept threatening to kick me out and didn't give me a chance to talk.  So two Apple "managers" argued over an bad quality cable with a very loyal customer making a scene. Every other customers was listening and hearing this.  Not good Apple. Not good Apple.  Really need to learn to listen to your customers, re-evaluate your cable quality (this is not a unique issue), train and empower your associates, and stop making bad quality yet expensive products that you cannot stand behind! Still cannot believe that Apple argues with a loyal and good client over a stupid cable. The worse thing is both Mike and Liz were being racist to me since I observed after they were rude to me that they were nice to clients that are white and tall and didn't interrupt or talk down on them. I can back this up with facts!  Apple needs to take action ASAP or it will loose all good clients and market shares!

title: Apple Review
text: I find Apple to be a very reliable phone software, as well as easy to navigate and stay organized. While many consumers are likely to complain about the screen/phone durability, I have only cracked 1 of the 4 iPhones I have owned in the last 8 years. That being said, there was no case or screen protector on and it was towards the end of my contract. Although I am not contracted (through phone service company) by how many times I drop my phone, I am contracted by every 2 years and how ever many drops that time frame entails. I appreciate the sleek design of each device, as well as size variation. Other features I like are group FaceTime, flash on front and back cameras, and the health app.

title: Apple refuse to replace battery just because
text: The battery life of my carefully looked after iPhone dipped below 84% so I opted to replace the battery before the cost went up in the New Year. I assumed it would be very straightforward, but it was far from. The technician at the Genuis Bar ran a test and told me that he wouldn't replace the battery as there had been some water damage. I expressed my surprise as I am very careful with my phone and had never allowed any liquid to enter the phone, but the man refused to change his mind.  However he was very happy to sell me a new replacement phone (iPhone SE 64GB) for ten times the cost of replacement battery.  Ker-ching for Apple. Disappointment for me. Whatever way you view this, Apple is trying to wriggle out of its promise. It's not in its warranty, just a statement on its website.  Apparently that battery replacement programme was hitting the bottom line to much. Why not sell customers a new phone instead? Check out those bottom line figures now! Job done. Apple investors 1 - Apple customers 0.

title: Apple needs to improve.
text: Apple just isn‚Äôt the same anymore, I have been a loyal customer for over 5 years as my first iPhone was an iPhone 5s, the first day I got it i was extremely excited as I was able to afford it. Nowadays, apple is just tossing out a repetitive iPhone every year with an increasingly higher price tag. I‚Äôm going to stick with apple for now as I am thinking of upgrading to an iPhone 8.

title: Very Disappointing
text: Very Disappointing. I had an issue with my 4 year old MacBook Air which would not complete booting up. After spending over two hours with the online chat support, who tried their best to sort the problem out but couldn't, they suggested that I take my laptop to the "genius bar" in the Aberdeen branch of Apple. Surprise, surprise the genius couldn't fix the laptop either and diagnosed a faulty hard drive. He did however give me two options. I could either stump up ¬£360 to have a new hard drive fitted or pay over ¬£950 for a new one. Now, I appreciate that this laptop is out of warranty but surely, given that this is a premium product with a premium price, it should last more than four years. I asked if there would be any goodwill gesture towards the repair. No I was told "that's not our policy". Would there be any kind of goodwill gesture if I bought a new laptop. No I was told 'that's not our policy". Would there be any kind of trade in value for my existing laptop against a new one I asked. No I was told "because it's not working". I pointed out that we have at least eight Apple products in our household but the fact that we are loyal customers and have spent thousands of pounds over the years on their products makes no difference because "everyone is treated the same". If this is Apple's idea of good customer service then it is no wonder that their sales have started to fall. People will only pay a premium price if they feel they are getting good value and as far as I'm concerned on this occasion they are way short of the mark.

title: Apple Inc spits on Steve Jobs legacy
text: I bought the iPhone 7 plus because I have always been an Apple fan and I was excited about the nice camera on the phone. I have had this phone for two years now and recently the phone began to have major issues. I am unable to make or receive phone calls as the sound does not work...being unable to make phone calls can be extremely dangerous and phone calls should be the ONE THING a phone can do. The headphone jack is also not working so I have to use bluetooth headphones. Also, the camera refuses to actually capture photos half the time (on the camera app as well as on apps like snapchat, instagram, etc.). SO, the phone cannot do its basic duty (making phone calls) and the main feature I was excited about (camera) is buggy and only works half the time. I have only owned this phone for two years, it should not already have a myriad of issues like this.  Since the phone had been having issues I decided to schedule a Genius bar appointment and drive two hours to the nearest Apple store. Before even beginning to run diagnostics on my phone the employee explained that the sound issue sounds like a known issue happening with iPhone 7's with the sound card. He then ran diagnostics and found that this was the issue. He explained that these issue were not my fault and I had done nothing wrong but that the new ios they had pushed through had "brought forth issues" in many iPhone 7's basically rendering them unfixable and useless. I asked him about the other issues my phone was having (camera issue mainly) and he said that at this point those issues are a moot point since the phone is unable to function as a phone due to the sound card issues. He then proceeds to tell me that since I was no longer under warranty he would not be able to replace my phone unless I paid them $340! So basically, Apple pushed through an ios update that broke my phone and then expected me to pay them money to fix their mistake.  I tried to reach out to Apple to just find out WHY they would not offer to fix their mistake without requiring a huge payment and the representative didn't respond to my chat she just disconnected. I have also submitted a feedback review to them about this and fully don't expect a response. I am disappointed in Apple and what they have become. Apple no longer represents innovation and quality. They're products climb in price but drop in reliability.  I loved Apple. After this experience I wont buy Apple products ever again.

title: I bought my apple mac book pro in 2018‚Ä¶
text: I bought my apple mac book pro in 2018 July, spent about close to $3000 CAD with the expectation that these machines are reliable and it would be rear that they will give me any issues, apple as a brand so much trusted my friends and family that i blindly bought this for my work. Here is what annoyed me and make me write this review and if some one is listening or reading this review, better do something about it to change my views about apple. One night i was about to sleep and my mac book was low on battery and died on me, I thought I will charge it in the morning, So when next day I plug it to charge the battery and check my emails,it never switched on, I called apple support they told me that my OS system is some how gone and they helped me to reload the operating system, I got very worried from that  day onward as battery dying is normal when you are binge watching Netflix, to add more to my worries, when ever i switched my mac book on, I see a grey screen  for few seconds, which i clicked pictures for my record to show to the technician at apple store, another occasion was when the screen started top flicker in middle of something important i was doing and than a strange sound started to come on its own from the mac book and i recorded it all and tech heard it. So now when i go to apple store to get my issues resolved, first of all i had to wait for 5 hours before i can see the technician and than when i finally see one they spent 5 mins and told me that the diagnostic that they did every thing appears OK but i should leave my system, with them to dig deeper. I asked what if they do not  find anything wrong, than she said i just have to keep working on the laptop until something really happens, So my concerns is the problems my mac book is having is recorded and the technician saw them and had no answer what and why they were happening, what if once the manufacturing warranty is over would they give me a new laptop or  fix it.This is not fair that to charge hundreds and thousands of dollars for your products but when it comes to customer service and customer satisfaction you are so poor that you have no concern or empathy for the customer who spent all that money and now have to live with this doubt that there is something wrong whit the laptop that apple cant explain. I am one unhappy client that apple has lost today, I  was thinking to upgrade all my office systems to apple but not any more, first you pay $$$$ for apple products and than wait in line for hours to see the technician and than at the end they do not  take any responsibility of there products. So apple no more place for you in my world and that what i will market to all my family and friends and on my face book.If any one is bothered than do something about it.

title: Stop buying Apple products!
text: For years me and my wife and obviously many others, have been throwing money at apple to the point where apple apparently feels they no longer have to provide quality products and services. People stand in line for days to discard hundreds of dollars, so they became careless, selfish and mediocre. Our first Apple products were great. As the years went by, it appears we all were easily sucked in for one of the most expensive product lines of crap. Our last few experiences with Apple products and customer service were so bad that I have decided to stop buying Apple products. Stop dying to give them money before their stuff is even available!  Let it get dust on the shelf and maybe they‚Äôll eventually produce a dependable product! Everything started with my phone having issues with my voicemail. As I use my cell for business in a daily basis, I would receive calls, and many times voicemails. Every time I would want to listen to my voicemail the phone will freeze, and I would have to restart it with the power button. I‚Äôve been dealing with endless calls and customer service iddeaots and unreliable AppleStore Appointments, for about a year, until I had to switch to 8Plus. The issue was with 7Plus...that 7Plus was replaced few times, couple times because of the voicemail issue and once because the screen failed. Everytime I had to pay a fee. Whyyy? Why paying fees when the damn phone screen fails after a few days the phone has been replaced??? Then I made a purchase online for Cyber Monday, suposebly there was a $100 discount stated clearly on the website, to find out after I made the purchase that the $100 was, in fact, an extra purchase for $100 Apple Gift Card. What a load crap!!! After pouring thousands every year in Apple products, to waste a couple other days of my life to clarify and fight for the $100 discount it‚Äôs just above and beyound. I hope that $100 will freacking make them a lot richer.  And now, my wife‚Äôs watch touchscreen just came off, out of the blue the $900 freacking watch failed after just a year. My wife is on her way to the Apple store to get a watch replacement. Obviously, I expect like $150 or $200 fee....why, why pay a damn fee when ur products keep failing?!!! I am done!!! I will switch and turn away from Apple and I will make sure all my friends and family will hear my story and I shall do my best to convince them to turn away from these crooks!!!! BAN Apple forever!You‚Äôll also look less like some iddeaots standing in line waiting to throw money into the toilet.

title: Excellent!

title: BEWARE of updates
text: BEWARE!  DON‚ÄôT DO APPLE UPDATES!!!! I don't even know where to begin.  I am just going to post this in every venue I can find on the internet.  Since I have wasted five days of my life trying to deal with this issue (two of them while on holidays in a sunny warm destination), I figure wasting a few more hours will just make me feel better.   Apple finds a way to vehemently deny that a software update caused my issues of not being able to hear and use my phone.  The phone is greyed out and the Imessage is intermittent as well.  Face Time?  A thing of the past.  I was on a cruise ship and did an update.  When I got off the ship I tried to call someone.  The call went through fine but I couldn't hear them and they couldn't hear me.  Now I am on holidays dealing with Apple Support.  I went to two other independents and they told me I had to go directly to Apple.  Today is Wednesday and I have been dealing with Apple Genius Bar and Apple Support since last Friday.  The only thing I know is that my phone was working perfectly fine before I did the update.  I read people online having the same issue.  Apple told me that it is only about 1% of apple users that have this problem and there is no fix and no solution other than buying another phone.  So, I have wiped and restored my phone three times now with three different Apple support people.  I was told to escalate my file to Tier 2 when calling in.  I did  just that.  Now I have wasted another six hours of my life today dealing with a Tier 2 manager and just hearing the same thing.  It is a hardware issue and not a software issue.  Ironically at the exact time I was waiting for my phone to reboot, my girl friend tells me she is having the exact same problem with her son‚Äôs phone.  Hmmmmm.  Two of us?  Best friends to boot.  But its sheer coincidence that this is happening to us.  According to Apple.    A hardware problem not a software problem and therefore we are on our own pay to fix.  After drinking the Blackberry koolaid it took me a very very long time before I switched to Apple.  Now I have been an Apple supporter for many years now.  I switched as everyone used to tell me that their customer service is second to none.  They sooner just give you a new phone then face bad publicity.  I guess the big Apple giant wiped out a competitor with Blackberry and now they have a controlled monopoly of the market and therefore their customer service can go down the way side like so many other large companies.  I‚Äôm just letting people know that if they are having the issues too  their pain and frustration is valid and you are not losing your mind.  Regardless what anyone tells you, you know that your phone was working fine before you did the update.  I just want people to read this and find comfort and solace that they are not alone.  At the end of the day I have to buy another phone.  I have no option.  What I chose to buy is still the big question.  I am sure that everyone out there, regardless of the device they have, someone has had a bad experience with it.  Android?  Blackberry?  Apple?  Plus One?  At the end of the day, they will always have issues.  I think I feel better for voicing my opinion.  LOL!  Good luck to all of you that share my experience.

title: Do not buy
text: I am a cyclist and a runner. I was using the power beats3 by Dre and Apple. Love the sound and the fit. I purchased the power beats3 less than a year ago and I am in the process of having them repaired for the second time. The battery life is not anywhere near the 12 hrs that are advertised. After 6 months the battery life did not last more than 45 minutes during my rides or during a workout in the gym on a full charge. What an inconvenience. When I called customer service, they tried to charge me $107 (nearly half the price) because they said the warranty was up even though it has not been a year. Because they were fixed, I had only a 90 warranty from when they were supposedly fixed. I have had a pair of the HA-EC20BTJVC headphone that have lasted longer and kept the charge that was advertised. So I purchased a set of Power beats3 by Dre for nearly $200 and did not receive the product that stands behind the name that it advertises. This post will definitely be shared on all my family and military social media. Friends and family please share this so that someone else does not purchase apple products.

title: No longer cool to own an apple! It‚Äôs time to toss the rotten apples!
text: UPDATE: I had said days in my review. It took over a year before my issue was resolved. I did not keep my crapple and am happy with my new one. For years people have been throwing money at apple to the point where apple apparently feels they no longer have to provide quality products and services. Hype is all they need. People stand in line for days to hand over hundreds of dollars, so why worry about having quality stuff backed by good customer service?       My first apple products were fairly recently. I didn‚Äôt stand in any line but was a sheep following others into the deception apple had created. I suspect the ‚Äúi‚Äù stands for ideeott/s as we all were easily sucked in for one of the most expensive product lines of crap. Stop dying to give them money before their stuff is even available. Let it get dust on the shelf and maybe they‚Äôll eventually produce a dependable product. You don‚Äôt have to be the first to have a pos. It‚Äôs faster, cheaper and is what it is to take a baggie and follow a dog around. You‚Äôll also look less like the ideeott standing in line waiting to throw money into the toilet.      So instead of buying products because someone else has them or all the hype must mean it‚Äôs good needs to be replaced with reading reviews and finding companies who truly want your business and respect you as a customer. My research and my experience leads me to understand there is no way apple has any respect for us. I bet they never did, especially watching movies about apple.  That‚Äôs when it dawned on me what the ‚Äúi‚Äù probably really stood for.      I‚Äôve been trying to work with them for days, like all the others in these comments and there is absolutely no customer service. I have now given up and am researching new companies to replace what will soon be known in our household as ‚Äúapple frisbees‚Äù. They‚Äôre not good for anything else. I found some awesome items out there that seem much better and priced more reasonably than the apple pos line of products.      No wonder the only review sites I‚Äôve seen that offer some praise for apple are sites where employees give their opinions on companies they work for. If I got paid big bucks, benefits and didn‚Äôt have to do any work at all I would give good reviews too. No one at apple seems to care at all, but there comes a time when you have to care because it will all come crashing down if you don‚Äôt.       Small ‚Äúa‚Äù was intentional. They don‚Äôt deserve my respect either. Wouldn‚Äôt take correct spelling, but the word is the only word to use.      One thing seems consistently true ... if there‚Äôs hype, it wasn‚Äôt good enough on its own.

title: Problems with Apple 2017 21.5‚Äù iMac and  iPod Touch.
text: I bought an Apple 2017 21.5‚Äù iMac on 20 May 2018 from a well known high street chain. During the first two weeks  I had several instances of ‚ÄúLoss of Connection‚Äù between the Magic mouse + keyboard and the Mac. Then about 1 month in, the performance became slow with delays of about 15 seconds to open up System Preferences, Pages docs, Google and search results etc.  Apple Support tried to help interactively but were unable to solve the issue. At the same time, the mouse pointer began to freeze regularly, usually accompanied by ‚ÄúLoss of Connection‚Äù icons for the mouse and keyboard and the window for the ‚ÄúBluetooth Setup Assistant‚Äù. With an unresponsive mouse pointer, I invariably had to shut the machine down using the power button.  Over the following weeks, Apple Support tried again to sort this without success and by mid July the frozen pointer with associated alerts was happening 4 or 5 times a day. I was eventually told by the retailer‚Äôs support team that a Bluetooth problem seemed likely as there had been some reports of poor soldering between the Bluetooth module and the motherboard on these models. However he did suggest that I try moving our cordless phone base unit out of the room as these had been rumoured to interfere. This did not help so the Mac was returned for repair on 20th July but when I got it back on the 22nd August it was damaged and I was offered a new one by the store. This second one worked well until again about a month later when the exact same problems recommenced. We started disabling the Bluetooth in some of our personal items, such as phones, iPod etc., to no effect. By 27th September we were once more confronted by frozen pointers and having to switch off on average 4 times a day so the second Mac was returned for yet another new one. By this time I was almost reluctant to use the thing and we had turned Bluetooth off in everything we could think of in our house. But sure enough, on 22nd October, the stuck pointers all kicked off again. I had up to this stage avoided upgrading to IOS Mojave as I‚Äôd heard that many users were facing system crashes and suspected it was the cause. However in desperation I upgraded in case the Bluetooth issue had perhaps been solved within Mojave.  Unfortunately it made no difference. I finally returned iMac number three on 14th November for a full refund. To be honest, I would have considered sticking with the iMac if I‚Äôd been able to use a wired mouse and keyboard. It would not have been ideal but I would have put up with it. However I learnt that Apple had apparently ‚Äúde-stocked‚Äù their corded ones everywhere so that was not going to be an option. ( As a side note, my son‚Äôs iMac is about 7 years old and when he recently attempted to install Mojave, it failed. Not because the processor is no good or there isn‚Äôt sufficient memory or the hard drive is too small. It‚Äôs simply that Apple deem his iMac to be too old i.e., they want customers like him to go out and buy new ones. He would understand if the specs were not up to it but that isn‚Äôt the case. Like me he has lost all enthusiasm for Apple products and is currently investigating a Windows replacement. ) Further Update: Having just purchased and set up a Sonos Beam soundbar, I thought I would download and install the Sonos Controller App on my 5th generation iPod Touch just as a back up in case our smart phones develop a fault. Surprise Surprise !!!!! It‚Äôs not possible to update past v9.3.5 on this iPod. It just doesn‚Äôt get any better with Apple does it ? What utter rubbish.

text: Rude and insulting attitude from Apple Regent Street staff. They are still in the dark ages with no interest in demonstrating good, polite, respectful customer service. I have never had such a couldn't-give-a-damn experience from staff (mostly male) at a store.  If this were Selfridges, Harvey Nichols, John Lewis, etc... apologies would have been made along with a gesture of goodwill. But at Apple Regent Street the staff just continued to be rude - despite me losing approx 1.5 days of my life at their store and feeling wretched and exhausted by it - and yet they still remained totally clueless, at that store, as to how they could/should fix the problems (that they had caused) on my device and to my data! Ironic that they call themselves "Genius"! Despite one female "manager" at the store assuring me that I would be contacted within the following week to make good with a gesture of goodwill, no such call or email came from her/them. Some weeks later, more hours of my time was wasted again there, when each member of staff yet again (as they always do) insisted that I go through the entire story of what had previously happened. And on this occasion the "manager" belittled and smeared me... and then confirmed a couple of hours later that his earlier dismissive and belittling statements (about me) had been false. But still no apology.  The staff consistently demonstrated such poor judgement and lack of consideration and sensitivity towards me and caused me so much stress, wasted time and energy - and yet they did not care. Their non-existent customer service was and is embarrassing, shameful and unprofessional.  The recent news of Apple's losses came as no surprise after the recent appalling experiences at Apple Regent Street.

title: Only way to challenge Apple is to pay for a good lawyer
text: I paid for an Apple battery replacement.  This broke the home button (of course apple disputes this - but if you search the web this can be related).  Here are the negatives: 2 week delay in responding  Writing a formal letter of complaint you enter another maze of customer service reps Plain english is not used (entire sentences are constructed using words like respond, outcome, dependancy creation).  Or pay ¬£270 and we'll think about giving you some free headphones Final outcome is that you have to pay for a lawyer to pursue a complaint with apple, or pay full rates for a issue they are likely to have caused.

title: No longer the Apple of my eye
text: My functioning iPhone 6 started crawling immediately after a 'software update' then I read stories of phones noticeably performing slower. Apple fessed up and said it was for our benefit as the phones might suddenly overheat and die, well mine never did and how about informing us as to your reasons? No, which convinces me they were in fact caught out. They got around this by offering a discounted replacement battery. So I paid and had a new battery installed. The next software update however instantly killed my phone and lots of others too looking on the web. Apple care said it was just a software glitch so take it to a Genius Bar and they will be able to do more to fix it. Yes you guessed it, a standard reset with the 'expert' then pronounced my phone as dead. So within fifteen minutes I was passed over to a salesman and ended up buying a new phone, their cheapest phone for ¬£750. Before all you Apple diehards tell me I'm making this up and am in some way anti Apple, can I just say I've been exclusively Apple for fifteen years plus the exact same fate befell my iMac four months earlier and Apple care said it sounded like the logic board had failed which basically meant you might as well buy a new iMac. Fortunately for me however I have an independant Apple repair centre near me who simply reinstalled my software for ¬£200 and my machine is as good as new Sorry Apple you are about to learn that it is foolish to trade on brand name and start treating loyal customers like cash machines

title: It‚Äôs all about the money!
text: These poeple are only in for your money, they do not care at all about you as a customer. I had some PowerBeats that needed fixing and they said they couldn‚Äôt fix them but rather send me refurbished ones for $99, these were still under the year warranty and brand new ones costed at the moment $199.99. Also, my Iphone 8 Plus got a small crack in the darn home button, the phone has had a glass screen protector and reliable case ever since I got it, and they said I‚Äôd have to pay $169 only to replace the home button. However, why would they not make a glass protector for the goddamn home button if it‚Äôs going to be easily cracked. Also, the way they market their products is totally against us consumers, the Iphone 8 Plus was the only big option when the X came out and that is why I chose it, they said they‚Äôd charge wirelessly and while they do, the Iphone 8 doesn‚Äôt charge wirelessly if it has a case on, unless is a very slim UNSECURE ONE, so in order to charge it wirelessly you have to remove the case, which is a no go due to the whole phone being made of glass, so you‚Äôre risking your phone falls and if this happens Apple will tell you that you are probably better off getting a new Iphone. It is very evil on their part because as soon as they come up with the latest Iphones the first thing they say was ‚Äúoh they charge wirelessly EVEN WITH A CASE‚Äù. Totally acknowledging that their previous models did not charge wirelessly with their cases on. I am not upgrading to an Iphone once i pay off my current Iphone 8 Plus.

title: Apple Ruined My Phone/Bad Support
text: I purchased an Apple iPhone 6 about 4 months ago from walmart.com.  I deleted the app store icon from the home screen and it deleted the entire app from my phone.  So I called Apple support to get the app reinstalled.  For some strange reason, they were not able to get the app store back onto my phone.  They told me I would have to reset my phone to the factory default.  With their help, I did this.  Apparently, it was not really changed to the factory default because it still had my old apple id and password in it.  It needed both of those in order to work.  I remembered the ID but not the password (it was very old).  For the next 6 WEEKS Apple support was not able to help me get my password reset.  I had to provide proof that I owned the phone which I did (purchase receipt, T-Mobile contract for the phone, and VISA receipt of the purchase).  I was told it would be a month before my phone could be restored.  It's a long story, but after 6 weeks of talking with one Apple "specialist" after another, I still cannot use MY phone.  Their so called technicians have no idea what they are doing and kept my case moving in circles with no resolution.  I am now going to purchase an android phone.  They cannot get my phone to work and will not replace my phone.  I'm fed up with Apple.

title: Good iPad, can't use iPod touch 6G any more.
text: There is a reason I didn't decide to get the iPhone XR. It is overpriced. title: Good...but deteriorating
text: I have had an Apple iPad Pro since it came out and although I love every function and App on the stystem, Voiceover  and dictation is getting worse with each update.  As a blind person I  use voice-over and Siri alnost daily to navigate around the screen And also use  dictation to speak out messages (such as this).  The problem I find with  dictation  is that it constantly mistakes words and phrases into something that is completely out of line with what has actually been said,Also it seems to repeat or change part of the sentence automatically without  users Interference. I personally do not Have an accent And speak fairly slow so I see no reason why this problem is there Other then there is an issue with the voice recognition with every update.  As a result I  am Constantly going over my texts and changing errors Takes quite a lot of time, especially when you want to send a simple message to someone.  Other than that I love apple and their  products.

text: Although the iPhone has some redeeming features you won‚Äôt have the battery life to enjoy them. title: Apple doesn't stand behind their products...
text: I purchased an Apple iPad Pro 12.9 13 months ago. Earlier this week, I came into my office to launch an app and my iPad was off. My first initial thought was that it wasn't charging. I checked the charger cable and it was working. I tried charging it with two other cables and it still wasn't responding. I went online and tried to troubleshoot the issue to no avail. so I ended up taking it to the Apple store for support and they were also unable to determine the issue. The man that helped me even commented on how great of condition it was in and that he could not see any damage to the outside of the device. I was told that since I'm 37 days outside of my warranty, that I would need to pay $600 to purchase a new one. If I had of damaged the device, I would have no problem paying the replacement fee but being that I used the device as it was intended and did not damage the device at all and it stopped working, it disappoints me that Apple won't stand behind their products. We have so many Apple products in our home, as I sure many do, but after this experience, I doubt I will continue to use their products. We all work hard for our money and it's very disappointing to make a purchase on an item that you believe to be high quality and by a company that one would assume to stand behind their products to only find out that neither is the case. After this experience, I'll take my hard earned money elsewhere.

title: Left me without a phone with unwell newborn baby
text: I sent my phone off to Apple for a new battery to make it more reliable.  It was supposed to take 5 days maximum to fit but three weeks later and after endless web chats they admitted to loosing my phone. I told them several times I couldn‚Äôt leave the house as I have an unwell newborn baby, I needed a temporary phone urgently encase I need to call the hospital if my baby had another seizure. They did nothing and kept making me drive to my parents house to use their phone to call Apple support as they couldn‚Äôt resolve the issue online, but did nothing to help the fact the only phone I had was lost by them. They eventually offered me ¬£70 compensation which a week after offering was cancelled and they sent me a pair of headphones and a refurbished second hand phone. The phone they lost cost me ¬£750 to buy brand new and they replaced it with a second hand one. Every time I made the journey to my parents to use their phone to call Apple support I never got an answer or update on my phone and was often in tears pleading with them to send me a temporary phone encase I need to call the hospital for my baby. Every time I went via online chat I explained I am in a really difficult situation with a unwell child and no phone and they still did nothing. My dad had to buy me a pay as you go phone and Apple have refused to refund me for that. I am absolutely discusted with their service
